Reviews.Title: “Rooms let it down”
Reviews.Author: shellclark2000
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a nice location if you want to be in ‘old’ Rome. It is very near the colosseum. It’s about a 15 -20 min walk to the trevi fountain so I wouldn’t say it was right in the centre. The nearest place to go eat is Trastervere which is about a 10 minute walk over the river. You can get get a good deal there, 3 courses plus drink for 8 Euro! The reception staff were very pleasant and the hotel lobby is very nice. When we first arrived we were given room 104 on the ground floor, this room is quite large, clean and modern with a lovely bathroom although the window is so high up you had to be 9ft tall to look out of it..so I asked to move the next day and we were given a garden view room (double standard) . This room was like a shoe box and not worth over 200 euros a night. After complaining they upgraded us for the last night into a junior suite room. This room was fantastic and more like the rooms you see on the website. One good thing about all of the the rooms was they have the most comfortable beds I have ever sleep in!!! Breakfast has a very good selection of fruit, toast, pastries and hot food. This is included in the room rates. Overall I think the double standard rooms let down this hotel down unless you pay extra for the junior suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value - First stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Stephen O
Reviews.Content: I went here with my girlfriend last November, based on reviews, photos and the location we decided to stay here. Overall I was very happy with the Hotel and our stay here, it definitely surpased our expectations and we had a very reasonably priced Junior Suite which we stayed in for five nights. The hotel staff were professional and friendly, The hotel was quite modern and as mentioned by others the garden was quiet a nice addition. The views were quite beautiful and the hotel is right across the street from the Roman Gardens, 2 minutes from the Circus Maximus and 15 minutes from the Colloseum. I felt quite lucky with the location. Of course, there was the subway and bus service but we liked to walk everywhere in the center and visit the main attractions. which is definitely possible from here. The hotel room was a 2 floored junior suite. The bathroom was clean and modern, there was a sofa, nice view and TV downstairs and a comfortable bed upstairs with another big tv. I loved the room's style and had no problems or concerns with it, I think the hotel excels in this category. Breakfast was nice, there was plenty of it but really we stuck to coffee, fruit and yogurt. Overall I was pleasently suprised with the Hotel and with the prices on offer would be happy to return. Sadly we did not try the restaurant, judging from the menu it was reasonably priced and it had a decent variety, but we had too many restaurants to try in the city in only 5 days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Excellent Location and the Service to go with it”
Reviews.Author: Lee B
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend went for a long weekend away to Rome and decided to book Hotel Kolbe through Expedia. We got a good price and were even given a FREE upgrade to a suite after paying for just a standard room upgrade. The location was excellent, near The Forum ruins and the local Metro station (our form of transport) was only ten minutes away. The only thing we struggled with was actually finding the Kolbe hotel upon arrival. It took us two hours of transporting our luggage to and from different locations from where locals had directed us - there was not any detailed directions on the hotel's website. Excellent trip nonetheless!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for famlly stay in rome”
Reviews.Author: NyLilli
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Had first floor family duplex suite. It was actually two separate rooms 'connected" by common hallway door. So when you close the common door and open the individual doors, it is a big suite with two flat screen tvs,two bathrooms. In our case also two beautiful shuttered doors to gardens. beautiful spot. felt like we had our own backyard. Front desk and staff were friendly,very attentive and accomodating. From helping point out sites on map to giving us practical tips on visiting certain sites, also very good arranging last minute tour for us. Great breakfast included in stay. Wifi also included. excellent housekeeping. Old, pretty building with nice detail. We had quick good rooom service for a late night snack for the kids. The location was great. Walking distance to many sites and restaurants across the Tiber. There is a little restaurant on the same block but I don't recall the name. They were opened late with decent food for late night meal after sightseeing. Also great map at front dest, tear off pad to help yourself. would highly reccommend and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: stabard
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel though British Airways as it was located next to the Forum and near the Collessum ( these were the top of our list to see). Easy cab ride from the airport ( 40 Euro's). Our room was located on the ground floor and was small but perfectly formed. As we faced out onto the road there was some road noise but to be honest we were so tired after walking round Rome all day we slept like a log. The bed was very comfortable, infact we slept through the breakfast one morning! Breakfast was fine. Nothing exceptional but plenty of choice and enough to keep you going whilst doing the sights. The hotel looks out over the Palentine Hill and is an easy walk to the Collesseum. We did not use public transport but walked all over the city. The map from reception was very detailed and was looking very dog eared after 3 days in and out of the bag as we toured the city. The hotel offers tours but we booked with Alex Mariotti and never regreted it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel on perfect location”
Reviews.Author: rhdetiger
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, very good price, very nice room, great breakfast included. Most attractions in walking distance. Very friendly staff ! Free wifi, but lost connection often. Was not a major concern to us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Good sized room and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: ewersocki
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located directly behind the palatine hill and a short walk from the colosseum and forum. Despite guidebooks saying there were few good restaurants in the area we found several within short walking distance that were good value for money and the food tasted good. Whilst staying we used no public transport, however the vatican was a good 40 minutes walk away. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful, all the usual toiletries were available in the room however at request you could have several other items free, including a disposable razor and shaving cream (which having travelled hand luggage only was extremely useful) The hotel was clean at all times and recently refurbished to a good standard. The room was a very good size. Breakfast was included and had a good range of options including hot breakfast, fruit, cereal, cold cuts and pastries. I would definitely return to this hotel if I visited rome in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Clean and great breakfast. Location good, not awesome”
Reviews.Author: TheEducatedTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in January 2012 with my boyfriend after doing business there. We stayed there for approximately a week and it was very clean, modern, pristine, and had a wonderful selection for breakfast everyday. Cold cuts, yogurt, juice, croissants, toast, fruit, cheeses, etc. The staff was very nice and accommodating with our requests, they even helped call a taxi for us at 5am to go back to the airport. The rooms were good size, the only weird thing was that the doors were sliding doors to the bathroom as opposed to actual solid doors, but no big deal. The location was good, as you could walk up the street and turn the corner and see the whole Forum/Colosseum, but it was a bit further to walk to other sites and not exactly on top of a Metro stop or bus station. Either way, very nice experience and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “just okay”
Reviews.Author: chicago12chicago_IL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during the first week of October 2011. The room was a good size and clean. Breakfast at the hotel was okay. The hotel was slightly further away from the attractions than we had originally thought and also a bit further away from the public transportation than we would have liked. Ended up taking a cab in Rome more than we had planned. Overall it was okay but if we ever return to Rome we might try to find a hotel that is closer to a metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: London_Reiver
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night in March. Although I was on business the hotel was so well placed I managed to see a large number of Rome's greatest monuments; - Colosseum - Arco di Costantino - Circo Massimo - Colonna Traiana - Monumento a Vittorio Emanuele II (to list only a few) All are within strolling distance from the hotel whilst not forgetting the heart of the old Roman city was the view from my room. This was road side though and I wold swap this for a quieter side of the hotel. The rooms although small were clean and comfortable. Breakfast was sufficient and the staff were pleasant on check-in and departure. If I was coming back to Rome for a personal visit I would be very happy to use this hotel. The only thing that would make me consider somewhere else is the 200 euro room rate charge. Location says a lot though and hotel has that.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet 'n Spacious”
Reviews.Author: Thierry O
Reviews.Content: Spent some days in Rome with Family and Friends. Excellent location actually next to the Forum Romanun. Rome modern city center is at walking distance (15 mins walk). Hotel is located in very quiet street and is well equipped, good breakfast and clean. When you want a trouble-free stay in Rome, we can advise this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ronni O
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 5 nights and we have only good things to say. We were tree siblings traveling for a long weekend. Beautiful rooms, clean and tidy. we had a view to the back garden which was very beautiful and quite. Breakfast is very good with all you need for a days' start. The lobby staff is very nice willing and helpful. Location wise - very nice area not far from the old streets of the center. We came with walking spirit and did that a lot so we felt the location is very central. We would definitely return next time we're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, (almost) perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: rcs1980
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel directly through their website, as the price wasn't different from other booking websites, and had wifi connection included. The hotel is very nice, modern, clean, spacious. Big lobby, nice reception staff, very helpful and spoke english very well. The room (superior double) was very good. Again, lots of space, big bathroom (with bathtub) and all the toiletries needed. It had patio doors directly to the hotel's garden, which was beautiful and very quiet (only heard the church bells ringing on sunday morning for a few minutes at around 8am). Breakfast was good, though on saturday morning it was very crowded and understaffed. This reflected on a slow service cleaning up the tables, and setting them again for new customers, and refilling some of the food platters as well. Nothing that would bother you if you're not on a rush. Otherwise, nice pastries, fruit, yogurts... a bit disappointing to have a automatic coffee machine in Italy (a hand made cappuccino would be a lot nicer). WiFi didn't work very well in our room, but maybe that's because it was a bot far from the reception area. In terms of location, the hotel is just outside the roman forum (though the entrance to the forum is on the opposite side - 10 minute walk), very close to circus maximus. There are lots of buses just on the road behind the hotel and across from circus maximus. Easy to walk to Piazza Venezia (through a hill - Capitol Hill), and just across the river from Trastevere (great for restaurants and bars - 10 minute walk). Rome is a walking city, so pack your comfortable shoes, and you'll have fun! No problem leaving the bags at the hotel on the last day.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth B
Reviews.Content: Before booking  this hotel I took my  time to read other traveller's oppinion on this hotel and as most of reviews were positive I decided to book at Kolbe  Hotel. And I didn't regret at all! People who say it's distant from the places to see say rubbish! It's enough to take the look at the map of Rome and see that it is in the middle of the center - of  ancient Rome!!!! It was spetacular to wake up in the morning and look out of the window watching the ruins of the ancient Rome just across the small street!!! It gives you the sensation to go back in time, a unique sensation that only few hotels in Rome can give you,trust me! My room was spotless and cleaned every day, also towels and bedding replaced regularly. Another thing I have noticed on some reviews is that the rooms were small! Of course ,they are ,if the people who wrote those reviews expected the stadium court to sleep in???!!! The spatial scale of my room approached the size of some suites at other hotels in Rome I stayed in !   The breakfast in the hotel is more than average being the continental buffet style; fresh fruit ,bacon and scrambled eggs replaced regularly,all kinds of yoghurts and cereals,fresh bread and pastries every day and also some home made cakes that are gorgeous! We ate dinner in the restaurant one night and the food was fantastic, fresh spaghetti with seafood were the best we ate in Rome! The service and the staff is excellent! Kind ,welcoming and friendy, all english speaking!!!!   Rome is beautiful and staying in this hotel made it unforgetable for me and my husband. We would stay again without a doubt and I reccomend this Hotel to everybody who wants to enjoy Rome and its rich history! Thanx kolbe hotel and the staff...we will surely be back soon Elisabeth, London

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Kyle B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and friendly with a beautiful garden out back. There were however a few downsides. The continental breakfast was ok, but food lacked variety and local flare. Just your average scrambled eggs and bacon and juices/cereal. We stayed at this hotel for a week and the breakfast was identical everyday. I would have liked to have had some kind of variety in what was available. As for the location, it was quite good but be warned it is quite far from Termini and the local shops in Circo Massimo close very early. One night we wanted to get a bottle of wine and had to venture to Termini which was not very fun. Overall clean hotel with average rooms. Location was decent but was a bit of a hike to most major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A real find in Rome, quiet but central.”
Reviews.Author: Greengozer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Kolbe hotel for four nights at the end of February 2012. I have to say firstly the service we received was superb, the staff were very helpful and check-in and out was a breeze. The hotel itself is in an amazing location if you like the forum architecture, the coliseum and a quiet location, its perfect for you, it sits just off the track at circus maximus and within a walk of about 10 minutes of one of Rome’s metro lines, Rome only has two metro lines by the way, but it is a nice walk to it. We were given a courtyard room, with large doors that opened up into a private garden space which the hotel is surrounding. This was a nice surprise and was very picturesque, the patio bar attached to the restaurant offered a nice quiet area, with the exception of the Sunday morning bells, to sit and enjoy breakfast & coffee. Breakfast was included in the package we booked, and we found the buffet breakfast well stocked and with ample selection to suit the carnivore or vegetarian and everything in between. Rome is always a walking holiday and this hotel is ideally situated for a walk around the back towards the coliseum or around the front and along the river Tiber. The room size was good, not too large, but in comparison to some of the rooms I’ve previously stayed at in New York or Paris, I found it ok, not huge, but with enough space to relax. The hotel has a maze of corridors that made finding our way back to the room interesting, but overall it was fine and comfortable. On the whole the staff was really friendly, there was one staff member who could come across as rude if you put him in an American, Irish or British context, but really he was helpful, if only seeming slightly rushed or hassled. All the rest of the staff would bend over backwards to complete a task, and we were there in their quiet season so they did everything with a smile even with the seasons minimum staff requirements. . I would defiantly recommend this hotel to my friends; in fact I have already recommended it to my parents for their next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Food and Affordable!”
Reviews.Author: UkBobsgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I brought my brother to Rome as part of his first trip to Europe. I would happily stay at this hotel any time I am in Rome. The hotel is modern, clean and comfortable (except for the pillows, but that is strictly my opinion).The staff were friendly and very helpful. The restaurant of a hotel is often skipped, with travellers choosing to eat out. This restaurant was great - attentive, knowledgable waitstaff, and really good delicious food. Great for family, couples, or single traveller - especially any traveller looking to discover ancient Rome. The view out of our second floor window was of the Roman Forum!! The weather was great, sunny but not too hot. Feb meant the lines were short, and there were some areas closed for renovations, but not enough to feel cheated of spectacular sites! There are even hop-on hop-off bus stops nearby at the Circus Maximus. See the map I have photo'd if you need further encouragement to stay at this gem!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Holydays!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tamara142
Reviews.Content: I've spent one of the best Holiday of my life in this Hotel. I've booked the room on Internet and it was safe and fast. The rate was good as they offered a discount for a 3 nights stay. I suggest to book even their limousine service from the airport as it is a very confortable way to arrive in Hotel in a big city like rome ( the airport is 40 minutes by car from the Hotel). I was immediately impressed at the arrival as the lady at the desk seemed was waiting for us like good friends,. she gave us a very warm welcome, explaining all the Roman attraction, monuments and special places to visit like Campo de Fiori, Trastevere, Panteon and others. Ohhhh Rome is incredible. I couldn't imagine how many things you can see even without paying any entrance fee!!!! All churches are free, Saint peter basilica, Panteon, Mouth of truth. You even have fantastic view from terraces like in Campidoglio from where you vcan see all the Ancient Forum with the place where Giulius Caesar was burned!!!! Than you have the fantastic squares: Navona, Spanish Steps, Piazza del Popolo and the fountains. The Hotel staff helped me to book the entrance for Galleria Borghese. This is one of the place you can't miss. Sistin Chapel of course have to be visited. I bought a guided tour in the Hotel and it has been very good and confortable. After all this visiting I tell you that a relaxing break in the hotel restaurant in the evening is a very surprise. Excellent food, friendly staff, fantastic wine and honest price. try it!! I suggest you the Amatrichiana Pasta. Is a tipical roman food that I had the chance to eat in many italian restaurants but here at Kolbe it was simply superb!!! Next time I come back to Rome it will definetly be KOLBE HOTEL! SPECIAL THANKS TO ALL STAFF THAT MADE MY HOLIDAY UNFORGETABLE! Tamara, Montenegro

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality Hotel in the middle of the History!!!!”
Reviews.Author: baracaya
Reviews.Content: I have choosen this hotel for the position and for the suggestion of some friends. I couldn't do a better choise. The Hotel is in a fantastic area in the middle of the archeological site. I can't say how many monuments you will find around the Hotel: Circus MAximo, Ancient Forum, Mouth of Truth, Venezia Square are only some of the fantastic places nearby. Trastevere is Just few steps as well as the Coliseum. Ancient building but totally renewed so you can find an exiting mixage beetwen the history and the modern. When I discovered the breakfast tables in the garden I wanted to try even the restaurant at night and I "fell in love" with their food!!!! In Rome is quite easy to have good food, but the taste of their kitchen served with the lovely dealing of the staff seems to bring you in an other age like in a Michelangelo paint. I think this is the best place I have ever been and I want to thanks all the fantastic persons that work there for their kindness and friendness.

Reviews.Title: “kolbe hotel rome”
Reviews.Author: anna l
Reviews.Content: Rome is incredible and this hotel is the best to visit all the archaeological sites. It is in the area of Ancient Roman Forum. There is only a small street between the hotel windows and the ruins of Roman Imperor Houses so from the room you can see all time the monuments. Colosseo, Circus Maximum and so many other monuments are few steps from the Hotel. Behind the Hotel there is a very beautiful Church and an antique marble arch. We have walked a lot as Rome time is never enough to visit everything. Near the Hotel there is even a City Tour stop and I think is the best way to have an overall idea of the places. So many places have not to be missed: Saint Peter and Systine Chapel, The Squares and Trastevere. At night we used to come back in hotel and have dinner in the very quiet restaurant. Good food and staff. Hotel is very clean and modern, has good services like good breakfast, wifi in the room, and a beautiful garden to enjoy a drink in relax. The room was big and with a Jacuzzi bath that we enjoyed so much. We were very happy to have chosen Hotel Kolbe.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful hotel in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: R1chard
Reviews.Content: This hotel is delightful. Despite being centrally located and within walking distance of all of Rome's main attractions it retains an air of peace and tranquillity. The staff are extremely pleasant and helpful and the room we stayed in was superb. There have been some reviews here which mention that the breakfast is perhaps not what you'd expect from a four star hotel and whilst it was more than adequate, being of a continental type with fresh bread and pastries every day, it may not satisfy those who demand 'the full monty'. It is perhaps a little surprising that the management of the hotel have not taken heed of the comments here as it is clear that they read them. The restaurant is overpriced even by Rome standards but there are plenty of restaurants within a ten minute walk from the hotel including a little one called Anima Mundi just 50 metres from the hotel which has received many excellent reviews on Trip Advisor (although the reality doesn't quite live up to the expectation so be warned!). The room heating is a bit eccentric as no matter how often you turn it off it contrives to turn itself back on again. All in all, and despite my comments above, this is a truly excellent hotel and should I find myself in Rome again I would have no hesitation in booking a room here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for walking Rome”
Reviews.Author: Andyolly
Reviews.Content: Well located, most of Rome's sites are within a 20 minute walk. Hotel is reasonably comfortable, quiet, with a good, though not outstanding breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Did not want to go home!!”
Reviews.Author: Sofija M
Reviews.Content: We spent four beautiful days in this marvelous hotel. We booked with Cathrine and she suggested a Family Suite for us. What a Suite it was! The bathroom was all in marble, hydrojets in the bath and the views of the garden! All of that, while the birds were singing in the morning. Rome is incredible with so many historical monuments and this Hotel was right in the middle of it all. I highly recommend this hotel and please don't forget to try the food at their restaurant! The kitchen and the food is of top quality and superb! Table settings are elegant and you have a chance to even eat in the garden if it's not in the winter months. We will definitely be back someday! Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abbysdadgary
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a lovely 3 night stay at the Kolbe hotel arriving on the 9th Feb. The hotel staff were all very welcoming and friendly. When we arrived we were given a map and shown places to visit. The maps are just on the reception desk and really easy to read. Our room was a suite overlooking the Gardens and was very quiet at night. The rooms were spotless and cleaned everyday. Breakfast was Continental buffet style and bacon & scrambled eggs being replaced regularly so always fresh and plenty of fruit yoghurts cereal croissants etc. The location was great for the Roman Forum and the Colosseum with all the other sights within walking distance. After a full day walking around Rome it was nice to sit in the bar and have a glass of wine and had a good laugh with the staff on the bar and also chatted to other residents who were also there to see the Rugby. Unfortunatey it snowed the weekend we visited so the Colosseum & Forum was closed but we still saw lots and now have a great excuse to go back later in the year. The hotel can also arrange taxi transfers at good prices. We could not fault the hotel, staff and the standards (My husband works abroad so stays in hotels all the time and is very fussy & he didn't complain once). When we left I realised I had left some clothes in the wardrobe and rang the hotel from the airport so they are posting it over to me. Will definitely be revisiting and would recommend it to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and a good base to explore”
Reviews.Author: mark rh15
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights during the snow at the beginning of Feb. Staff all very helpful and all spoke very good English on reception. The room was modern, spotlessly clean and had a very good heating/aircon system. The heated towel rail in the bathroom was very welcome as we had too dry out some clothes after the snow. Breakfast was typical continental and plentiful. Coffee machine was a bit of a let down. The best point of this hotel was its location. Very easy to walk to a lot of the major sights including the Forum and Colosseum. Little tip is too pick up a free map from the reception as we found it a lot clearer and helpful than our guide book one. Booked through British Airways and it was a bargain. Would definitely recommend this hotel. especially through booking with British Airways

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: yokester
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights here and it is very nice. the staff are very friendly and helpful. the buffet breakfast is as mentioned in other reviews a basic continental with scrambled eggs and sausages as well. it is help yourself and the espresso machine works fine. the location is excellent especially for seeing the Forum and colosseum. it is a farther walk to the Pantheon, Trevi fountain and Vatican. the price of the room was very good, and the room itself is comfortable (especially after the micro room I had at my last hotel here in Rome near Trevi). it is spotlessly clean and very nice bathroom. I didn't eat dinner or lunch at the restaurant, but the prices there are high, even for rome. 16-18 for Primi and 22-28 for Secondi (Euro). I would stay here again and recommend it for anyone coming to Rome for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - would definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Becs101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend for my birthday. The staff were all extremely friendly, helpful and welcoming - a great asset to the hotel! The hotel itself is in a beautiful old building, but is very modern and clean inside - our room was perfect! And the location is ideal, as you can easily walk to the Colosseum and access all of Rome's attractions on foot. On our first evening in Rome we ate in the restaurant. The steak was excellent, but the seafood spaghetti was very disappointing - just containing clams, and very dry (no sauce!). However, the chocolate fondant for dessert was wonderful, and we were given a plate of homemade biscuits to nibble on whilst we waited for the dessert to bake - delicious! The only downside we found to this hotel was breakfast, It wasn't to the high standard that was set in every other area. You are very much left on your own to help yourself to drinks, food etc., but to be honest, I would expect waiter service in a 4-star hotel, at least for hot drinks. Also, the cooked breakfast looked to have been sitting out for quite some time, and didn't offer much choice. A menu of freshly cooked hot breakfast items would have been much nicer - especially seen as it was snowing during our stay! If you're happy with basic fruit, bread, ham, cheese and yogurts for breakfast then you will be fine! All in all, an excellent hotel, and I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary location, beautiful design and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hollern
Reviews.Content: Extraordinary location: in the heart of Rome, close to the acient ruins, to the old city of Michelangelo and Bernini, to delicious food and nightlife in Trastevere Beautiful design: medieval walls in combination with modern luxuries and simple but high-quality Italian design Friendly staff: delicious breakfast buffet (especially in Italy!) and welcoming, helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Position - Lovely Hotel - Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: KatlRegensburg
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a short Rome trip (with a lot of snow!!). We stayed at the Kolbe Hotel as friends recommended it to us. The position is great..you can walk to all sightseeing points in the city centre...just for the great location I would choose this hotel again. Our room was a brilliant Suite on two levels with view to the garden. We just a booked a regular Double Room on the hotels website but the nice lady at the Reception showed us even a Junior Suite on two levels with mezzanine and garden view....and for only 40 euros per day WE GOT IT!!!! ...and had direct view to the garden with snow-covered orange and olive trees. Spectacular! Breakfast is very good, much more than you expect. Because of a lot of snow we decided the first evening to have dinner in the hotel and enjoyed the good italian pasta, the cosy atmosphere and all the great staff! Hope to be back soon...next time in summer!

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice”
Reviews.Author: Sem H
Reviews.Content: The Rooms are quite old and moldy, at least thats how it was on ground floor. Location is not great as it is advertised, its quite a long walk from all the main attractions. The Breakfast was basi, althoughthey have a nice garden outside,but birds are really annoying since they are used to people there and are continously around the tables. The waiters are trying their best to shoo them away.There are lots of mosquitos in the garden area. Either have some insect repellants or sit indoors. We had one note of 500Euros mysteriosuly! disappear from our room. We had to make several calls before someone showed any attention. They were unable to deal professionally at all with our situation. Best answer they had was you probably lost it somewhere else, which was impossible. Although i requested to speak to the manager we were told he was not available at night and would get back to us in the morning. He didnt even bother to see us or call at least. I would have called the police if i wasnt in a hurry to catch a flight. if you decide to stay here make sure you dont forget anything valuable laying around in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and average”
Reviews.Author: Noora H
Reviews.Content: Best thing about Kolbe hotel is the location. Hotel is on a small quiet road, but still within´ walking distance to many sights of Rome. Hotel was clean and the room was ok. It wasn´t very big though, especially the bathroom, and we didn´t have much of a view... We stayed on the first floor and had our window to some kind of backyard. Window was also placed quite high we couldn´t really see outside apart from some sort of fire escape stairs. Breakfast was ok and most of the staff were nice. One unfortunate incident took place on our last night in Kolbe hotel; we didn´t sleep very well, woke up with noise and it was really hot in the room. Finally in the middle of the night I realized that the window of the room was totally open! Maid must have left it open while cleaning the room in the afternoon, and we didn´t notice it because of the curtains were closed. Basicly anybody could have climbed to the room and steal our belongings. Ok I get that accidents happen, but when I went to complain the next morning the guy at the front desk just laughed and didn´t even apologize.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for a place to saty in Rome..look no further!”
Reviews.Author: meg d
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were planning four nights in Rome, we had never been here before and because we didn't know the city we were finding it hard to find the right place. This 4star hotel was beautiful, absolutely spotless, staff tidied everything right down to lining up shoes every morning! The breakfast was by far the best continental I've had with a lovely patio outside which was perfect for us (it was july). The staff couldn't have been more helpful,providing maps and each morning pointing out attractions, bus stops etc. It was only 80 euro per night per room and we were literally walking distance to everything. The roman forum and colloseum were about a 3minute walk, trevi fountain and the main square maybe 7minutes...amazing location..perfect for those wanting to sight-see!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: evawinnz
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Rome in January and it was a great decision to be going to Rome during winter! The temparature was relatively mild but none of the sights were overly crowded and everything was open. Kolbe Hotel was excellent - the room was huge and overlooked the garden - views of palm trees and the forum included. The bathroom has a very impressive bath tub / shower and I was also pleasantly surprised by the complimentary Salvator Ferragamo toiletries (I believe that's what the brand was). The cocktails at the hotel bar were lovely and the staff were very friendly - they really did go the extra mile! The hotel is also not very far from the railway station and from Termini it was only a 8 Euro taxi ride. It is so close to everything as it's right next to the forum romanum that one can really explore Rome an make the most of the trip. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: SCLDN
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a perfect location for sightseeing in Rome. The room was lovely, the staff were helpful and breakfast was lovely. The view from the window wasn't great and the room was very expensive, but the location of the hotel really made up for this. It was right next to the Forum, yet the road we were on was pretty quiet and atmospheric, compared to the rest of the city - not much passing traffic or many tourists that we could notice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Great location, very friendly staff!!”
Reviews.Author: AngryBirdMSP
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and myself stayed they last year. We stayed there with anoth couple. We loved the hotel, breakfast was awesome!! Rooms are typical european in Nature. Shower rocked. We had a first floor room, which is kinda below ground. Not the best room for a view but great sleeping room. Staff was very helpful and helped us very much!! Would stay there again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the worst Hotel and should be closed”
Reviews.Author: ajp166
Reviews.Content: I arrived back from Rome a few hours ago and feel so aggrieved that I am writing this immediately! Hotel Kolbe was a total disaster! Our room was located on the 1st floor right near the parking area so sleeping was not an option, every car that would pass would wake us up! The Air con was not working (room was boiling hot) so I was sweating in January during the night which my partner and I found horrendous. I have stayed in many hotels and have never had any issue, this ordeal has left me feeling physically sick. The Hotel computer kept crashing so using the internet was not an option, I asked the manager if he could reboot it and he said no it was broken when it was obvious that it had just crashed. I asked the reception for a number to call BA on saturday (4pm) and was told BA do not work until Monday, I had to call someone in the UK to obtain a number, the manager spoke to me like I was completely stupid and it was unbelievable. That night after I had asked for the BA number we received 3 calls to our room where nobody was responding from the other side, one of the calls was at midnight, now nobody knew which hotel we were staying at so I can only assume this was one of the hotel staff. My Girlfriend was actually nervous on our last night in Rome and wanted to check out at 2am! When I checked out yesterday morning I was next in the queue, when my turn came the lady said I need to check out the person behind you as they are very important.... I was in such shock I could not even respond. I am extremely upset and am considering some form of legal action this was meant to be 3 nights in Rome and it has turned out to be the worst three nights of my life. I cannot explain in words how bad of an experience we have had with this hotel. As for location as others have said its around 3 miles to the centre so I don't understand when people say the location was great! I suspect someone is writing reviews for this Hotel as it is a horrendous place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast, unique room – some service problems”
Reviews.Author: ohno4
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is the selling point – the Forum/Palatine is the front yard. You can walk around the Forum, past Circo Maximus to get to the main entrance and the Colosseum. The hotel is a converted convent, which makes for an interesting back story. Rooms are small but nice, we had one with a loft. The ceilings are exposed brick and wood beams. Tall windows give a great view of the gardens. Since the back faces the garden, you don’t have to deal with traffic noise. Our bathroom was high end and spotless, but unfortunately smelled a little like there might be a septic tank problem. The bathroom in my sister’s room did not have the smell. Beds are European hard – no Heavenly Beds here. Nice, fluffy towels. Hot breakfast buffet is very good – eggs, sausage, bacon, cereal, yogurt, lots of pastries. I know this is pretty standard in European hotels, but I love the self-serve espresso machine. The front desk service is spotty – the woman at night was not friendly and made us take two trips back to the car to get passports (she did not mention the first time that she needed everyone’s passport, not just the person checking in). If you don’t have everyone’s passport, they give you a really hard time – something worth mentioning when you book. The gentlemen at the front desk were much friendlier during the day, although one worker gave us erroneous information when we asked about the hours for the Pantheon (he said it closed at dusk, it was open til 7:30pm, well past dusk). Rooms on the top floors were really hot, even when we turned OFF the heat. Left the window cracked all night, even though it was winter. At about $250USD/night (we had a discount), this hotel is a great value and you cannot beat the location. Because some of the rooms sleep four, families don’t have to get two rooms (a problem we have run into in the past when travelling in Europe).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very comfortable hotel, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous1010London
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a convenient location (close to Colosseum and Roman Forum) with really spacious rooms, good breakfast, friendly staff, overall lovely stay!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: stesler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a business trip in December of 2011. The location is amazing. It was a 5 minute walk to many of the major sites and the Jewish Getto. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel was nice, the rooms are a good size. Overall, I would recommend this hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel in the heart of Ancient Rome – Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: SonicDreamer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kolbe Hotel Rome for one night on the 25 September 2011 and made the booking on the based on the high Tripadvisor.co.uk member ratings and consistently positive reviews. During my first two nights in Rome, I stayed at the woefully inferior Atlante Garden Hotel (see my review on Tripadvisor). So, I was determined to find an excellent and affordable hotel for my final night in Rome and thankfully the Kolbe Hotel Rome met and exceeded all my expectations. I cannot recommend this 4 Star hotel highly enough and do not have any negative comments to make about my stay there. I only wish I had stayed there for my first two nights in the city as well. I would not hesitate to stay at the Kolbe Hotel Rome again if I returned to visit the city in the future. To keep this review simple, I list the positives about this hotel under a series of headings: The Room This was a Standard Double, but the quality and size of it was in keeping with a Superior or Deluxe Double. The room overlooked the Palatine, which was a special and unexpected added bonus. The spatial scale of the room approached the size of some suites at other hotels I have stayed in, except it did not have a separate lounge area. The main room and bathroom were in superb condition and kept immaculately clean. You do have the option to book rooms overlooking the rear garden too. The Common Areas The overall appearance of the hotel is modern, with a sense of elegant understatement. There is no ostentation and dramatic grandeur found in some 5 Star hotels and I’d say this is a refreshing attribute. The comfortable, spacious feel of the room extended to the common areas in the hotel, such as the reception lounge and restaurant. All areas were maintained to a superlative standard with exemplary cleanliness throughout, including the lobby toilets. A unique and delightful feature of the hotel is the rear garden, which has the atmosphere you would expect from a building which was a former monastery. The garden, weather permitting, in is a lovely place to relax and absorb the peaceful energy, which pervades it. There is a narrow terrace area on the hotel side of the garden, immediately outside the restaurant, replete with tables and chairs, where you eat your breakfast or dinner. The Staff I found all the staff I spoke to friendly, helpful and efficient. I was made to feel very welcome and enjoyed their urbane, Latin charm mixed with the right level of attentiveness. The Buffet Breakfast If this is not included with your room booking it costs an extra 10 Euros and is incredibly good value. The format is “American” with a generous array of fresh fruit, pastries, cereal, fried foods (bacon, tomatoes, eggs, etc), yoghurts, fruit juices, toast and condiments and hot drinks. The Location I don’t know what more you can ask for in Rome, except it being closer to the Vatican. As previously mentioned the front of the hotel overlooks the back of the Palatine, which adjoins the Roman Forum and is one of the largest settlements from Ancient Rome remaining in the city. You can walk to the Palatine and Roman Forum complex from the hotel in about 10 to 15 minutes. If this was not enough, the Colosseum is situated just to the other side of the Palatine. What more could you want if you have a short stay in Rome? I would allow a full day to walk around these three attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rathernotsay
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to Rome at the end of November 2011. We booked this hotel through British Airways Holidays. The hotel is lovely, quiet, clean and friendly. We went in the 'quiet' season so you often moved around the hotel without seeing any one. Hotel bar / restaurant was good with exceptional service. Rooms were a good size, the heating is particularly difficult to work out and in November when its still 18o you'd rather it was turned off but that is my only complaint. I would recommend this hotel to families, couples, a girls weekend, its perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and quiet”
Reviews.Author: ZanyB
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel very close to the Forum and Colosseum. Its a converted convent and the very wide corridors lined with room doors remind you of that. The cloistered garden is lovely and front desk staff very helpful and efficient - all staff very polite. Place is spotless. On the downside, you can hear noise from neighbouring rooms and my request for a bath was not met. The air con fan was not working and if you leave your room all power cuts out. As is common on continent there are no tea/coffee facilities and you have to pay for wifi even in public areas. Given price you pay to stay here a few more "extras" might be expecetd to be included. My basic room was 120 plus euros a night and while its a nice wee hotel I think more like a 3 star plus than a 4

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Littlevan
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for 3 nights 14-17/11/11 on our first trip to Rome, having done an extensive hotel and trip advisor search decided upon this hotel and we were not disappointed. First impressions, very good, very smart, modern looking hotel, fairly easy to find and in a great location in central Rome, an excellent base for exploring all the sights. Our first room was very stuffy with no working air con, hotel staff very helpfully moved us straight away and upgraded our room to a super king, larger room. Very quiet, comfortable bed, good shower and amazing blackout curtains all contributed to a very good nights sleep, much needed after lots of exploring by foot. The only slight disappointment was the breakfast, the usual continental style breakfast with eggs and bacon, but not great choice or quality, good coffee and 'cornetto' (Croissant) though. Would stay again if in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet oasis in the busy city”
Reviews.Author: EmySue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived to Rome on a rainy day in February. Reading my maps, the hotel seemed close to the metro's Coloseo stop. In reality, walking in the rain with our luggage trying to find the hotel may not have been the best idea since it took a good 15 minutes walking. We arrived to the hotel cold and wet and early. The front desk was very friendly and suggested we have some breakfast and warm up while we waited for our room to be ready. After a couple cappuccinos, downloading some tours on the iPod and planning our weekend our room was ready. We were on the ground floor opening out towards the garden. The view was beautiful. It was so relaxing and peaceful. The hotel location though at first seemed out of the way in the end was actually close to everything. We did the hop on hop off bus which has a stop by Circus Maximus which is close and convenient to the hotel. You are also within walking distance to the Coliseum and Roman Forum. We ate dinner at the hotel and found the food to be very good. I thought breakfast had the typical cold cuts, breads, yogurts, cereals along with some hot items. All good and continually stocked.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: emrodri
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, not very well known, good location, rooms seem recently refurbished and arenice and qiet. Great breakfast! Restaurant with limited menu but very good service.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: kajal1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ok. Breakfast was average. Reception staff were poor. I told them twice and emailed them before we arrived that we were there on our 1st anniversary! Yet he didnt do anything special. After the third time of asking he moved us to a room which was not facing the noisy room! I would still recommend people to come here. As its a good location and easy to walk to all attractions...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Flannie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Sept.30 - Oct.6, 2011. I really enjoyed the location and the staff were very helpful. The Breakfast was huge with many selections to choose from. The fact that it is an historic building that has been modernized is a plus. Lovely garden to eat in. Dinners were okay but not great. I would stay here again in the future. Easy walking distance to great attractions and local places to eat. The rooms were nicely done and well serviced by the staff. A real treat of a place to stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, superb location”
Reviews.Author: aligscott
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right next to the Forum and within walking distance of most of Rome's attractions and sights. Service is very friendly, particularly in the bar. Rooms are very spacious (our family of five were comfortably accommodated in one family room) and good value. The double glazing meant that the sounds of the city were almost completely blocked out. There are some small maintenance issues but nothing to concern. Check in was straightforward and quick, and the extra bed we ordered was ready for us on arrival. Reception staff were helpful and polite. The hotel has a lovely garden at the rear, ideal for evening drinks and strangely peaceful. All in all, I wouldn't look anywhere else when planning a stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accommodation for a perfect holiday”
Reviews.Author: Sheenybeen
Reviews.Content: We came here when the hotel first opened and it was just perfect. As it was our first time in Rome we did find it a bit of a mission to get here from termini however after studying the route we found it was only a short walk away located pretty much opposite the forum. The staff were amazing and one of the concierge even gave me a brief wine tasting lesson. Breakfast was fantastic and so were the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but not a 4*”
Reviews.Author: ABandJG
Reviews.Content: The Kolbe Hotel was a strange one, it had some really good parts but quite a few average parts. The lobby, reception and restaurant area looked great but the actual rooms were quite dated and had were in a bad state of repair in places (broken window frame, plugs hanging off etc). I think we were particularly unlucky and had the worlds tiniest hotel room, I was quite surprised having seen the website photos and although didn't mind too much as we were out exploring for most of the time I did feel a bit mislead. We did sneak a peek at a couple of the other rooms while they were being cleaned and ours was by far the smallest so it may have just been that we were unlucky. We found the staff really helpful and the room really clean but were disappointed with breakfast, it was just not what you would expect of a 4*. Over all it was an average stay, not too awful but not amazing either

Reviews.Title: “4.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: DKLC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kolbe in early October and were pleasantly surprised. The decent-sized room was clean, and the staff was friendly and helpful. It may not have that "old world" feel to it, but after many nights in Italy sleeping in "quaint" hotels, this was a nice break of modern. Breakfast was the same each morning, but was a wonderful start for tourist. Eggs and bacon provided protein for those long days of walking, Cheeses, breads, fruits, juices and pastries were also abundant. Location was great for my wife and me. However, we're walking tourist so doing 9-12 km a day isn't that unusual for us. Bus and metro connections seemed to be convenient for what we were doing. The Colosseum, which has a metro station, was less than a km away. The only reason I would dock the Kolbe down a half point is the lack of some travel niceties such as an iron and board in the room. I know I could have asked for one, but it would be nice to have it there when I wanted it. I know, I know....such a small thing (and it is). We definitely will be staying at the Kolbe the next time we're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lb1982
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel for our stay in Rome for our Honeymoon. The location is just steps away from the Roman Forum which means you are also just a short walk away from the Colosseum, and able to walk to most other sites easily. (Including The Vatican!) The hotel is new, and the staff takes care of it. The staff is friendly and helpful and really makes you feel welcome. The breakfast is a huge spread, bacon, eggs, pastries, warm beverages and juice, fruit, yogurt, and toast. Rooms are spacious and modern. We ate dinner in the restaurant one night, and were very happy with the food and excellent service. A bit expensive, but hotel restaurants tend to be. We had a lovely stay and would be happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “If I could give it 10 stars I would”
Reviews.Author: jmstanl85
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. It was so much better than I had expected albeit a little hard to find (but it's worth it because the location is serene and right across from the Roman Forum!!!) The hotel is brand new and shines from the moment you walk in. The gentleman at the reception desk in the afternoon was very pleasant and welcoming. I booked this hotel on hotwire and got an an incedible rate and it was worth every penny. I will stay here every time I am in Rome from now on. The room was very modern and clean. The bathroom was impeccable as though it had never been used and was completely marble. The shower had jacuzzi jets which was a luxurious touch for sure. The room and the bathroom had huge windows that opened out on a small courtyard and overlooked a hillside with lots of trees and beautiful old world Italian structures. There were large plantation style shutters that closed over the windows if you so desired but it felt like you were staying in a villa even though it was just a normal sized hotel room. It is literally across the street from the Roman Forum and no more than a 3 minute walk to the national museums. It definitely felt like a home away from home for this single traveler. I hope it remains a hidden secret because it is truly a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly pleasant but a little sterile”
Reviews.Author: Nick L
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite in September 2011. Overall the hotel is very nice and efficiently run. The garden is very pleasant and the room as good as expected. However given the price, and even allowing for the location, we were left with the feeling that we had overpaid slightly. There are no real facilities (what I would have done a for a dip in the pool after walking around Rome for a day...) and apart from the garden and restaurant nowhere to sit outside your room. The location is not as convenient as it initially seems, the only gates to the Palatine are on the opposite side (15 mins walk) of the park and likewise you cannot enter the forum from that side. It is however very quiet for a hotel in Rome and, once you find the way, fairly close to the Jewish quarter and the rest of the city (head past Teatro di Marcello). There are few eateries nearby and they generally seem not to be great; mostly aimed at diplomatic types or cafes trying to extend their hours into the evening. Walking another 10 minutes will find you in a very god restaurant district however. We didn't eat in the Hotel; while the food looked fine the prices were high even for Rome. The staff were great, very helpful and always very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “An Urban Sanctuary”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireBrigadier
Reviews.Content: Clean and well furnshed. Comfortable beds, very good breakfast, friendly helpful staff. Our room was at the back and therefore very quiet. Very few restaurants nearby, but a ten minute walk will take you over the Tiber and the back streets there give plenty of choice. A good bar down the road provides bothe decent beer (Warsteiner) and a limited but good value menu. There is also a Farmers Market open on Sundays just a tad further down the same road where you can snack and drink ridiculously cheaply. The only drawback to the hotel is that you really do need a taxi on arrival and departure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for Roman antiquities”
Reviews.Author: Kez1955
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome and we were very happy with the excellent location so close to the Forum, Colosseum, Palatine Hill, Circus Maximus and many more ruins within very short walking distance. Restaurants admittedly were limited on the immediate doorstep but many were within ten to fifteen minutes walk particularly in the Jewish quarter. We enjoy walking to see the sights and had no problem walking to the Vatican City, Campo Fiore, the Pantheon, Piazza Navona etc. I had requested a room overlooking the garden based on previous trip advisor advice but was allocated a room overlooking the street, upon pointing this out we were moved to a much larger room overlooking the garden which was far better appointed and was excellent. Sara on reception was exceptionally helpful, particularly as I was unwell for a number of days of our six day stay. She was a gem. We would have no hesitation staying here again. Included breakfast was expansive and very nice.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Florida, SOG, Hale Koa Honolulu Hawaii
Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location-Great”
Reviews.Author: RONDA11
Reviews.Content: This hotel has easy access to the Forum and Collesseo. We did have a problem with our room because the previous person ripped out a nightstand attached light and had it dangling by a wire. It took insistance on my part we were moved to another room. I don't stay in a place with exposed wires (220 not 110 for europe) especially because that meant that the matching light would not work either. Really, the maid had to see the fixture hanging by a wire, touching the bed. You could not make the bed without moving the broken light fixture. It could have been a problem because we prepaid this Suite with American Airlines travel before we left for Italy. I told the manager, I'm not nice when he told me to be nice & be patient. We had traveled back to Rome from Florence on a train, and I wanted to unpack and begin our 5 nights in Rome.....again it took my insistance on another room, and he upgraded us because I would not let him downgrade us to a double room when we paid for a Suite. The 2nd room had a lighted mirror hanging in the bathroom over the sink which had to be reinstalled. We asked twice for this to be fixed and it was finally done while we were sightseeing. I didn't ask for another room because I thought there probably aren't any more since it seemed booked. It was a better room, but there also was a wedding which went into the night with noise. We were so tired from sightseeing, plus we were on the 3rd floor, so we ignored it. Again great location for the sights of the inner City of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid staying when there is a wedding!”
Reviews.Author: Ru22
Reviews.Content: We booked this for our honeymoon. Generally the hotel is nice, modern and bright. It is down a back street at the top of Circo Massimo. we didn't have a room with a Forum view but our room had patio doors on to the garden which was nice and quiet. We arrived back at our room on our last night to find that a wedding party was set up 4ft from our patio doors. When we mentioned this to reception we were told to close our windows. The wedding party then moved up onto the roof terrace until the early hours and it was very noisy with loud music. All in all it spoilt our experience of the Kolbe and would put us off staying there again. incidentally, regular guests do not have access to the roof terrace which is a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Average Property”
Reviews.Author: Gaurav M
Reviews.Content: Hi, Based on the reviews of this hotel, I had forced my travel agent to book me in this hotel and even paid about 50 Euros for this hotel. I found this property very average and over rated. Staff at the reception are very courteous, rooms are good but breakfast is very average. They also charge for WIFI. Location is not great if you are on vacation as all attractions are far away. Only Colloseum is about 10-15 mins walk from the hotel. The closest subway is Circo Maximo which is also about 15 mins walking. Would advice travelers to stay in hotels near Republica which is city centre.

Reviews.Title: “A nice 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: jadestone8888
Reviews.Content: Kolbe is definitely a modern, 4-star hotel.The front desk staff were very professional and helpful. The location of the hotel is good if your interest is Colosseum and forum/Ancient Roman Ruins. It is relatively inconvenient for the rest. Bus stop is very close if you want to go to Vatican. Breakfast is very good. I think the restaurant is fine too, very nice service. Internet is not free, 20 dollars per stay. They actually helped to call taxi with fixed price of 50 Euros to the airport (Some internet information said it usually took 60 euros or more to get the airport). The reason I did not give high rating was because the "Quad" family room was not really a Quad room; It was just a 3-person room with a small roll-out bed. I had glimpse of some family rooms which seemed much bigger with separator in between. We booked through agency but not sure we got a smaller room. The toilet in our room gave out bad smell, and the smell was difficult to remove. It was probably just a bad luck getting that room in such a modern looking hotel. There are not restaurants nearby (hotel has its own), but it is 15-20 min walk to Isola Tiberina where there are a lot of night activities and eating sites on the banks of the river; foods there are not that good though.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tijana_11
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for a week in August. It is absolutely the best hotel, and made our Roman Holiday so much better! All the staff are so friendly and helpful, bending over backwards to help in anyway they can-and their english is amazing too! The rooms are brilliant- spacious, clean and modern. And thank god for the air con! The restaurant is a must for all! Its delicious, great atmosphere, and free chocolates with the bill, free champagne when you sit down, and a free lemon drink after desert. Wonderful! The waiters are brilliant, and on our last night gave us a free desert-we had been to the hotel restaurant 4 out of 7 nights though! Location wise too its perfect! Only a short walk to town, colloseum, palantine-even the Vatican is only 40 mins walk along the beautiful river. All in all, a great hotel at a great price! We would definately go here again, as it added so much to our holiday experience! Thankyou!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful suroundings”
Reviews.Author: MatsK64
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and have no complaints whatsoever, except that we asked for a room towards the garden in the back but got a room towards the street. It really didn´t matter in the end as the street was very quiet. We slept undisturbed! Friendly and polite staff, clean and modern rooms with efficient aircon. A 15 min. walk to the entrance of the Palatine and another 5 to Colliseum. A 10 min walk cross the Tiber to the Trasteverdearea with lots of restaurants. To the Vatican it was a 45-60 min walk through the Trasteverde, and the metro back to Circo Massimo-station took about the same time... Are you really tired of walking there are 3 restuarants 250 meters around the corner from the hotel. Took a taxi to Piazza Navone one night and paid about 12 EUR, walk back home took about 30 min. Taxi to Ostiense trainstation for a day trip to the sea was 8 EUR, the train itself 1 EUR... The reception ordered the taxi and it arrived within 5 minutes. If you don´t care for the hustle and bustle around the Spanish steps and want an undisturbed night of sleep in a nice hotell, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “They screwed us. No explanation, no excuses... Worst experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: Evans L
Reviews.Content: Had a reservation with this hotel Kolbe in March, 2011 (Rome Marathon, High Season, hard with free hotel rooms). I was calling the hotel (manager called Angelo), from Venezia FOUR days before arrival. He said they canceled my reservation (!!!) because there was smth wrong with my credit card (which is simply NOT true). I suggested another credit card, he replied- we have no free rooms for these dates (!!!). The following day I was surprised seeing they bargained my reserved double room for a threefold price (!!!). Dont know if this is OK for Southern Italy to screw customers like that. Really interesting! Beware of Kolbe!

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: fijime44
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the Kolbe Hotel. Location is OK but after you have done the forum and coliseum there is not much else in this location. Internet is expensive 30euro for the stay. Best part of the trip was dinner and drinks at the area trav..... - which is behind the hotel across the river, walk down the alleys ways to find some fantastic restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great but no Wow!”
Reviews.Author: ScanlanDurham
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Kolbie for 3 nights. The location is great, 5 to 10 minutes away from some great attractions and restaurants. The hotel itself does exactly what it needs to. We stayed in a junior suite which was perfectly adequate for our needs. The front of house staff were really helpful. We left after our short stay very happy with the experience. This is no 'mind blower' by any stretch but in terms of value for money and an enjoyable experience it gets top marks. Thank you hotel Kolbe

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Excellant staff, Excellant location and excellant holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Dale F
Reviews.Content: Stay here for 3 nights, 4 days back in June. Upon arrival the hotel ticked boxes and upon check in, it ticked more, get to the room and by now all the boxes have been ticked. Check in was very quick and smooth, had the bags brought up without a problem to our room, the room was lovely, absolutely fantastic, the air conditioned hallways in the hotel and in our room was 10 out of 10 after a hot June day in Rome sightseeing. Each morning we would go down for a good breakfast and come back to find our room already cleaned and all the toiletries replaced etc. Any questions were welcomed by the staff, for directions to such a place or recommending a good pub or restuarant to eat in. We ate in the hotel restuarant one night and that was 5*'s, just to warn you are paying 5* btw. Overall 10 out of 10 and will definately be staying again when I next go back to Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, breakfast, service, and trip help. Recommend”
Reviews.Author: romvf
Reviews.Content: We got in at 2am due to a problem at Ciampino airport. (We waited for a taxi for 90 minutes). But the guy at the front desk greeted us promptly and got us checked in in about 1 minute. We were very pleased with the room and stay overall. The beds are kinda weird, they are not springs, but foam only. We even heard some other people talking about it at breakfast. The refrigerator had some dirt/spilled drink or something in it, but no big deal. There was some kind of small stain in one corner of the ceiling. (three black marks about the size of a quarter nickel and dime.) The view from the room was not good, just an interior wall of the courtyard. But it was nice that they had outside shutters that you could shut to keep the sun off the window. The location is probably one of the best of all Rome! you are walking distance from the Coliseum, and literally across the street from Palatine hill. The breakfast buffet was great, we even took some sandwiches with us for lunch. At every corner whenever we needed anything, the hotel staff was very accommodating and helped us with anything we needed. Their were three problems with our stay, both very minor. 1. The phone in the room didn't work, so whenever we needed anything we had to go to the front desk. 2. There were only 2 English channels and no pay movies. 3. It was super hot and I ordered an iced cappuccino (which is not on the menu) and the bartender kinda frowned and said, let me make you something special. I figured she when what I wanted because I said I like cappuccino with lots of sugar. She made me something like that but added Baileys and Kahlua. I'm an alcoholic so I had to give it to my fiance.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Kolbe Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tenortom
Reviews.Content: Hotel Kolbe was superb with just marvelous service from its superior staff: Sara in the morning, Alessandro in the afternoon, Francesco and Nunzio in the evening, Marco & Giorgio. Each staff member adds their own incredible personal touch. Sara was so attentive and delightful, I dubbed her "Our Madre di Roma!" Hotel Kolbe provides a wonderful free map of Rome and Alessandro was constantly drawing directions on the maps for us. All Staff were superb and helpful in every way, especially in helping with dining reservations, tour hints and calling taxis for us. We discovered that Taxis are by far the best way to get around Rome. They are extremely reasonable, fast, convenient and reliable and Hotel Kolbe's staff called us multiple taxis every time we left the hotel. This was the best concierge staff I've ever seen. Hotel Kolbe is blissfully quiet and stunningly located right next to the Roman Forum, a short walk to the Campidolgio and the Capitoline Museum, a great starting place for touring Rome. Kolbe Hotel is a restorative oasis which allows one to escape from demands of strenuous sightseeing. Breakfasts are included and are delicious. I wish I were back at Hotel Kolbe right now, I could live there! Thank You All for such a Wonderful Time. You made us feel like we had a home away from home in Rome and we can't wait to go back. We felt we were in THE Best hotel in Rome, sparklingly clean, wonderfully comfortable and perfectly located with a gracious staff catering to our every desire. A delight.

Reviews.Title: “4 star? no 3 star yes”
Reviews.Author: scottiegal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights whilst on an European holiday. We had booked through Kuoni they reserved us a junior suite. The room we were shown too was strange for a suite!!! We did not like it and asked to be moved to one overlooking garden. This was done and we accepted the alternative. The room was basic and certainly not to a 4 star standard. There were very few amenities in the room. Breakfast was mediocre. It was in a good location though. Would we stay here again? NO

Reviews.Title: “Unique, Beautiful Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Need2Explore
Reviews.Content: This comes a little late so I'll make it short. The staff were very helpful, even allowing us to use their computer for other bookings and also giving us extra bottles of water free of charge. The hotel is a converted convent and they did a wonderful job redoing it. Beautiful, large rooms and space. Away from the hustle and bustle of Rome but within a 15 min walk to everything. And it's also a wonderful walk. Breakfast is good and with Nutella available how can you go wrong?! I would not hesitate to stay here again. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “I classic hotel in a historic place.”
Reviews.Author: forrwhat
Reviews.Content: I love walking cities ans I was worried that Rome was too spread out, but so far after my first night I have found that walking is in Rome the same as other great walking cities. The best way to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in a quiet part of Rome”
Reviews.Author: lvsena
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed for 5 nights in late July. The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood right near Roman Forum. The Roman Forum is literally right behind the hotel and Colosseum is about 20 minutes walk from the hotel. Trastevere neighborhood is 10 minutes walk from the hotel cross the river Tiber with great local restaurants. The other major attractions are bus ride away. The bus stop mere 5 minutes away. The hotel is clean and its staff are really helpful and nice, especially Karen.. she was very helpful!!! I booked the room directly through the hotel website so we enjoyed free wireless for our stay... bit spotty at times but I was able to skype with family members back home. the room and beds were pretty small but I've been told that's pretty much the case in most hotels in Europe... The breakfast at the hotel was plentiful with warm dishes as well as selection of pastries. However, the dinner was overpriced and not up to our expectation. We spent over 80 euro and didn't like a single thing we ordered.. very disappointing.. the first night's dinner across the river at Trastevere was less than 30 euro and we were completely satisfied.. needless to say, we only ate at the hotel that one time. My overall experience at Hotel Kolbe was positive and I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay at the Kolbe Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rcandresen
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice and loved it both times. It is within walking distance of all the sites of Rome. It is very clean and the included breakfast is wonderful. We have had a room that overlooked the Forum and a room on the courtyard. I liked the courtyard room better as we could sit outside.

Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing, highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Lifeisgood68
Reviews.Content: Great location, hotel faces the Roman Forum. Friendly, helpful . Breakfast is fantastic and plentiful. Sit outside on patio amongst the fruit trees. Great landscape, grounds and patios. Qiute different from many Rome hotels. Our family room had 2 levels, kids (11&13) loved that privacy. Bathrooms are beautiful. Rooms are clean. Evening, we sat on 2nd FL public patio to drink our wine, very relaxing and quiet, no one around. Ask about the history of this building! If you like to walk you'll be amazed how much you can cover. From Colloseum to Piazza Navona or take the subways. Very direct. Make sure you walk to Traverste (15mins) for the best restaurants and prices in Rome. Use the hotels booking company to take Catacombs bus tour. A must see!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location and quiet”
Reviews.Author: motherlovely1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with our children aged 9 and 10. The location is fab and we walked everywhere except the vatican. The hotel is lovely with very professional staff. The rooms are modern and overlook a largr garden where you can breakfast on the terrace. Pretty perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a bit of a walk to all the main sites”
Reviews.Author: lozmeister83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights as part of a holiday to Italy. It was a lovely hotel and the rooms were clean and there was no noise. Our room had an amazing view over the hotel gardens which, though small, were lovely. It is tucked away down a quiet street about a minute or so from the Circo Massimo and there are a couple of restaurants nearby but all the best pizzerias etc would require you to walk towards the main area near Piazza Venezia. The hotel restaurant itself is nice for dinner if a little pricey but the breakfast was a little limited though typically continental. The staff on the reception were very helpful and friendly and when we had a glitch with the hotel we were supposed to be staying in later on in our trip in another part of Italy they suggested good hotels that they had been to themselves. Overall, if you want a quiet base to be able to go out and explore and you don't mind walking a fair distance this is a great hotel to go to.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect new boutique hotel in an old location”
Reviews.Author: J0anna1999
Reviews.Content: The location of the Kolbe, right on top of the oldest sights in Rome, coupled with the best staff helped to make ours a perfect holiday. The Kolbe is a newly renovated converted monestary and boasts some nice room features like the option of a mezzanine level which was very helpful with us traveling with children. We could put them to bed and watch TV downstairs. The hotel also had a restful garden and a nice restaurant. Set on a quiet cobbled street, we can't find fault with the Kolbe. It wasn't just the front desk staff who were pleasant and helpful, but the waiters and waitresses also helped us with our plans and with our children. A delightful place we'd recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A Sanctuary in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TorontoDaveH
Reviews.Content: The Kolbe was our home for a week in Rome, and after a noisy hotel in Paris and a dirty hotel in Nice, we were glad we spent the money for a lovely place. We arrived at night, and were so pleased to open our blinds the followng morning and look up at the Roman Forum right outside our window. We were there for 5 nights with our two children 11 and 13, and when I noted to the front desk staff that perhaps we were not suited to a room with a round (!) bed, they very kindly relocated us to a room with a more conventionally shaped mattress (and good quality sofa bed for the kids), noted that it was a more expensive room, but that they would not charge us for the upgrade, which was nice, but seriously, a round bed for parents travelling with kids? Save it for the Honeymoon suite ;). Breakfast was good, except for the coffee, dispensed from a machine, which was lousy. The birds in the peaceful gardens are fun to watch but they steal food from you if you are not watchful. The location is amazing - short walk to Colosseum - the neighbourhood and the hotel itself are very quiet. It was a very classy place. I would stay here again if I could save up to do so. It was not cheap, even with a strong Canadian dollar vs Euro, but then again, you are in Rome! Good shower/bath facilities, very affable staff, really wanting to make your stay a pleasant one. If you can get a good price on a room in this hotel, take it! You will find it a very calming place to come back to after dodging cars and scooters all day.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: pfgum5
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, I was able to walk to most of the main attractions, the breakfast choices were outstanding, had dinner and food was great but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: clawsjd
