Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Kolbe whilst sightseeing in Rome. Very clean hotel and a great breakfast on the terrace. Staff were very good apart from one guy on reception who we gave our postcards to to post, and he slung them on the side, needless to say that nobody we sent them to has received them so far! Maybe he was just having an off day! Would have liked/loved tea & coffee making facilities in the room but managed without.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Alij1978
Reviews.Content: Great location near the Forum. Very clean rooms with friendly staff. For some reason I had a disabled room on the ground floor which meant the shower was weird but the room was huge.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and tastefully decorated”
Reviews.Author: DSChouhan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated away from the main roads and about 25 minutes walking distance from the Colloseum; 20 minutes from Trevi Fountain; 10 minutes from the Spanish Steps and major bus routes. The Vatican is best visited by bus or Metro. Although we were initially provided the wrong room, we were immediately upgraded to a superior room as a result of the mix up. The room had French doors that opened into the hotel gardens and a fabulous shower and Jacuzzi. However, we were surprised that there were no tea/coffee facilities in the rooms. The breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice for all diets and even more enjoyable to eat in the hotel gardens. Although we never had any problems with the hotel staff, we felt they could have been friendlier. Sara at reception was extremely helpful and spoke very good English.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: lucaerrante
Reviews.Content: As somebody else said, an oasis of quiet near the center of the city. Lovely garden in the inside, try to get a room facing the very well maintained ground (the ones facing the road could be noisy). A very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “A Haven Amidst the Antiquities”
Reviews.Author: chicagochic77
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location, especially if you love the Forum and other ancient sites. Quiet. Interesting internal design. Friendly front desk -- especially Sara, the evening reception person who helped with our reservations and gave excellent tour and restaurant advice. One of our favorite restaurants during our entire trip was Sara's recommendation -- Sora Lella on the small island in the Tiber. The family rooms are great for a family of four, though cramped if kids are older. Cons: WiFi was erratic and kept cutting out.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of comfort in the antique area”
Reviews.Author: vcjf
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to arrive in when you are exhausted. This is a real hotel with a entrance on a quiet side street next to the Roman Forum, very professionally run, charming staff - with what may seem a bit spartan decor, however, it's perfect for relaxing into Rome. The rooms have big windows that let in fresh air from the angle with views of the courtyard with lemon trees and a lovely garden and fountain, where you can take your breakfast onto the terrace, or your drink, next to an antique church. The beds are very comfortable and bathrooms beautiful, this is a place you can go straight to sleep in the daytime, it's so quiet. Plus, the breakfast is very nice. One tip (for Americans) is not to expect, in any hotel, to be served a fresh cappuccino/espress. Just have your fresh food and then go out into ROME to choose from the thousands of coffee bars.... take your refreshment a little at a time. Here you can get to a lovely chocolate bar, local market, church, and just around the corner is the prettiest bridge across the Tibor to the Island where there is a terrific restaurant. Exellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, nice and well situated.”
Reviews.Author: syl_rod
Reviews.Content: Nice building, quiet rooms, good breakfast, very nice place to stay. Well situated beside the Forum and Colosseo, near Trastavere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location in the heart of ancient Rome, tranquil garden and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: MWRoss
Reviews.Content: The Kolbe organised our hotel transfer by taxi and on our arrival at the hotel at 12 noon we were pleasantly surprised to find that our room was ready for us. Our greeting was both friendly and efficient and this approach extended throughout our five day stay – excellent customer service. We had been in touch with the hotel before leaving the UK and they were most helpful and informative, which was also the case when we were in Rome. We had a Junior suite on the top floor overlooking the garden, which we loved. We are a family of four with two boys aged 10 and 12, so the split level arrangement worked well for us. The garden was an oasis of calm and was a key part of our visit to Rome. On most days we returned to the hotel for an hour after our morning’s excursions to relax in the garden or cool off in the air conditioning before heading out for lunch and our afternoon activities. The staff were always on hand to provide drinks. The breakfast was super – plenty of choice, including freshly baked croissants and cakes, as well as the usual selections. Everything was delicious! Breakfast was served 7-10am, so good for those who like to get up and out on their sightseeing early. On our first day we went for a wander and came across the Café St Teodora where we had lunch. We liked it so much that we returned for dinner – in fact every night, as we tried out different things on the menu. We were made very welcome and it was lovely eating outside overlooking the Piazza della Consolazione. The hotel restaurant was over-priced which was a shame, as the service would have been excellent. Our internet access cost us 20 Euros for 5 days and proved reasonably reliable, if a little slow at times. The location is super - when walking only 15 mins to the Colosseum, 5 mins to the Circus Maximus and 45 mins to Vatican City. We enjoyed our growing familiarity with the ancient sites in and around the hotel, a key part of our stay in Rome. The Kolbe was a key element in our family experience of Rome, which was a fabulous five days for us.

Reviews.Title: “Hummm”
Reviews.Author: Tennis2316
Reviews.Content: We went here for your 1st year Anniversary...The location was great, as it was near trestvere for evening local food dinning. We walked alot as the hotel was not in the center of the city. Which is a good thing, as its too commercial there.. The breakfast was a bit, dull for Vegeterains to be honest. My only real complaint would be that, before i arrived i emailed the hotel to see if they could do something special for me and my wife. When i arrived they said they had it under control... So they gave me the worse room, which was facing the road with the cars being heard. I then went to reception to ask if we could change room. I reminded they guy this was my anniversary, as he had forgotten. He then told me to speak to him tomorrow. I then reminded him the next day , however again he forgot we were on our anniversarym fianlly after pestering him he changed our room to the garden view. Therefore when you book, please make sure you do not get the room facing the road. I would still recommend this hotel. Just...

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Juan_de_Cuba
Reviews.Content: great hotel and what a view. down a small, quiet cobbled street is kolbe hotel. right outside our window was palentine hill. a close walk to coloseum and other great attractions. take walking shoes as you can walk anywhere with so much to see along the way. the staff were very friendly and helpful. clean, quiet rooms. the grounds are lovely with orange trees, palm trees, even fish in a fountain. dinner and breakfast were great. would recommend this hotel to anyone and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated clean and pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alex-gad
Reviews.Content: On teh fence of the Roman forum. 3 minutes from Piazza Venezia. 15-20 minuts by foot to most piazza's. Clean and comfortable with a good basic breakfast. Staff is helpful. Big difference between garden and street facing rooms

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: gardeninggirl99
Reviews.Content: First time in Europe with my husband and young teenage son. This hotel was in an awesome location, very quiet and very clean. Breakfast buffet had excellent selection. We arrived from the states and pushed ourselves to go out and see the sites...little did we know that right above us were the Roman Forum and Palatine Hill. Then just around the corner was the Circus Maximus, the Baths of Caracalla and the Colosseum...all within walking distance. This was an excellent hotel and I would recommend it to anyone traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “It was all good!”
Reviews.Author: therese04
Reviews.Content: the family room was immaculate and spacious; had a fabulous bathroom; lovely garden views and the hotel breakfast was plentiful. we loved the location because each night we felt that we left the vibe of the city behind and retreated to this wonderful sanctuary.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Kendgolf
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for a holiday in Rome. Quiet location beside the Palatine and Forum. 2 min walk to Circus Maximus. 15min to Colosseum. The hotel is an oasis of peace in the hustle and bustle of Rome. Relax with a cold beer in the lovely gardens after a hard days sightseeing. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the breakfast is excellent just what is needed for seeing all the amazing sights in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay at very good location”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirlcph
Reviews.Content: The Kolbe is a nice average 4 star hotel with a very good location in the city center of Rome. It takes you 7 minutes to walk to Piazza Venezia and ten minutes to walk to Trastevere or the nearest metro. For the easiest transfer from Fiumicino either take a cab or opt for the local train (not the express) and get of at Ostiense and grab a cab from there. The cab drive will then take roughly ten minutes and will cost you approx. 10 euros (2 pax and two bags). For a roman hotel the restaurant offers a very nice breakfast buffet and the staff at the restaurant and the bar are welcoming, talkative and really helpful. The rooms are nice and fairly new but again no more than what you would expect from a 4 star hotel and some of the rooms have a very nice view of the Palantine (not the ground floor rooms though). When we visited unfortunately we had rain showers during some of the days so of course we asked if we could borrow an umbrella. On two separate occasions we were turned down and were told that they were just out, and on the third day the receptionist say that we could just walk to Piazza Venezia and buy one. We never saw a single umbrella from Kolbe during our 5 days at the hotel. I think it´s a bit arrogant to say to customers that they can simply go and buy a brolly from one from the street vendors, no one argues that it wouldn't solve the current problem, but we have plenty of umbrellas at home and I didn't want to pay for a brolly that wouldn't last the day (which it didn't ) just to have to buy a new one the next. I missed that kind of service and thoughtfulness from the reception staff. We liked the hotel for the location, the staff in the restaurant and the cleanliness and would recommend it for those reasons, but I wouldn´t characterize it as a very good experience. If 3,5 were possible Kolbe would get 3,5.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet hotel with lovely breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AetT
Reviews.Content: Me and my spouse stayed inhotel Kolbe, Rome in March 2011. Hotel room was too hot for us (+22C) and we had to keep the window open almost all the time. I don't recommend this hotel for families with small children, the road is awful to walk and people drive (as they do everywhere in Rome) as fast as possible. View was nice, breakfast great. Last day there was so many eaters that there wasn't almost anything to eat and staff didn't bring more. So big minus for that. Guy in receotion coudn't concentrate on one custom at the time, and we felt that we didn't get the attention we should have when we check-in. Check-out was quick and girl in reception was nice. The room was quiet, huge plus for that!

Reviews.Title: “Great for family with older kids”
Reviews.Author: awayfrommydesk99
Reviews.Content: Close to Circus Maximus and the Forum, great breakfast, good rooms, but watch out for the split level rooms if you have small children...Super staff.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay if you love Roman ruins”
Reviews.Author: Janet9988
Reviews.Content: This is a real find -- on a lovely quiet street that just happens to be directly across from the Palatine Hill, with a full view of the excavations, and down the street from a little-known view that is one of the loveliest of the Forum.I've stayed in Rome a number of times, in Trastevere, in the Campo dei Fiori, near the Piazza Navona. I feel that the location of this hotel has opened up a new Rome to me, one that has thrilled me more than any other. On the map it seemed a little out of the way; it isn't. Everywhere you walk is a revelation -- go down the street and there's the Circus Maximus. It's an intimate relationship with the past. One note of advice: if you don't like your room, request to see another. And another. We ended up in a standard double room twice as big as the ones we first were shown, in the old (but modernized) part of the hotel, which I prefer, overlooking the lovely back garden.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Friendly Staff. Good Food. Nice location.”
Reviews.Author: carrollbar
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay. First time in Rome and we were made to feel very welcome. Good dinner and breakfast. Very friendly staff and a lovely location overlooking the Forum and close to the Colosseum, just across the river from Trastevere. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay - location could be better”
Reviews.Author: newyorker88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel with two Adults and two kids. The hotel is nice, modern and the room was pretty nice, a duplex with a stairway to an upstairs bedroom. Bed comfortable and the hotel area very quiet. Breakfast was good, especially the unlimited cappucino machine. I have 3 cups! Another plus is that we arrived at around 8 am, and our room was ready. A big plus for them. The only negative is that while this hotel is located in pretty much the center of Rome, it did appear that we had to walk a lot to get to things. About 10 minutes to the subway, but many buses nearby..but trying to figure them out was a challenge. But, if you don't have kids, and you like to walk, you're really only about 15-20 minutes from lots of major sites...pantheon, Forum, Coloseum, etc. So, overall good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: JenandChris
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome from Venice via train. At the railway station we approached the official white taxi rank and was assigned a taxi by the guy in charge. Unfortunately, the older gentlemen driving the Opel Astra estate ripped us off. In what appears to be a typical ploy he didn't drop us exactly at the front door of the hotel then did a switch on the bank notes he was given so double charging us twice. The fare should be in the region of 15 euro so best to check with the hotel for current rates and be very obvious when handing over the money. The driver who took us back the station was of similar vintage (and car!) but we agreed the fare at the outset and counted it out very deliberately. Neither driver had their meter switched on and these are official taxis. The hotel itself is right next to the Forum and our room actually looked over the wall so at night we had no difficulties with the neighbours. The room was well insulated so the cobbles outside did not affect us. Actually when we first got there we were taken to a room at the back overlooking the courtyard but that had not been made up. This taken with the taxi ride and the attitude of the front of desk (who gave the distinct impression of being the owner) gave us a poor first impression of Rome which did improve as the stay went on. The location doesn't appear to be the most central as the streets are quite winding as you walk towards the centre and the Forum forms a large obstacle to getting easily to other attractions but which are actually close by (as the crow flys). In the same little street you will find the Belgian Embassy, an indoor farmers' market (Sat and Sun), a very swish bakery plus a nice little local bar where you can get nice toasted sandwiches for a packed lunch and watch the football with the locals - this is right across the road from the Circus Maximus. Ruined temples abound and you are right next to some amazing sights.Tour buses leave from just around the corner. We ate every night in the hotel where the food was excellent, as was the service - our waiter and waitress were very friendly and attentive. Breakfasts were excellent, particularly the fruit-filled croissants. The rooms are minimalist in style which can at first glance appear basic. However, the beds are very comfortable and the overall ambience of the hotel is stylish. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: AK511
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the kolbe hotel and was checked in straight away, the man at the desk gave us a map of rome and provided us with useful information on tourist attractions, a porter then took our luggage and lead us to our room. the first impressions of our room was that it was pretty small, it wasnt as large as the standard rooms we had seen on the website and the bathroom was also small, however I was so tired from travelling and the room looked very clean so I accepted also we did have a great view of the palantine hill from our window. That night we decied to wwatch some TV but the only channel we had in english was sky news and the sound kept cutting out, I didnt complain about this as I didnt come to rome to watch TV and this was just a minor annoyance. The next day we went down to breakfast, there was a great selection of food, cold meats, toast, pastries, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, cheese and ham toasties and cereals. there was also good choice of drinks, coffee, tea and jucies. My partner sampled just about everything and recommeded the pastries, I always opted for the english breakfast, it was acceptable but the eggs and bacon were very greasy and the sausage tasted like hot dogs, i still ate this everday though it tasted fine. If you do sit outside for breakfast you will be harrassed by pigeons, they wait for you to finish or turn your back and then pounce on your food, its a little irritating but you can just shoo them away. After breakfast we would go out in rome and explore the sights, I have to say that the hotel has a great location, its only a 10-15 minuite walk to the colosseum and about the same distance to the capitol and the Vittorio Emanuele II's Monument (which is breathtaking may I add). We went during furogusto and lots of resturaunts, bars, clothes shops and market stalls were set up on the side of the tiber, it was really beautiful lit up on a night and quiet cheap as it was mostly aimed at locals not tourists. we walked down the riverside ever night and it was only a 5-10 minuite walk from the hotel. There are some nice places to eat in trastevere just accross the river; try La Scala the food is quiet expensive but its very good quality and there were alot of locals in there. On the second day in rome i sprained my ankel and the hotel staff were kind enough to provide an ice pack for my foot, they were always polite and say bonjourno when they see you even the maids, who do a very nice job of cleaning the room, we always had clean towels, there was a smalll leak under the sink, we informed the front desk as we went out and by the time we returned this had been fixed, they provided good service and always tried to help if you asked for anything. We did eat at the hotel one night and were offered a complimentary glass of champagne, I had the steak with potatoes and red wine sauce, the food was good quality and the steak was cooked perfectly, buut prices were extortionate and we ended up spending 78 euros on 2 main courses and 2 drinks. I would recommend to eat out of the hotel and sample the local resturaunts. There is a very nice local pizza place near piazza augusto down Via Ara Pacis, its caulled luigis, just across the road from gusto's, about 4 euros for half a pizza and its gorgeous, we actually had seconds ( make sure you take a phrase book as they dont speak a word of english here and you will need to order in Italian) One more thing, the water in the hotel room is safe to drink and we filled our water bottles up everyday from the tap, neither of us ever got sick from the water, its also safe to fill up from the water fountains in the streets, and we filled our water bottles from these fountains everyday. overall we had a great holiday and the staff were friendly and provided a good service, the hotel had a great location and it was only minor things that lt it down. the hotel is expensive but then most hotels in rome are. We paid for a four star ,we got four star service and we got a four star environment.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms and conveniently located.”
Reviews.Author: Supertravelmom2
Reviews.Content: For a European hotel, the hotel room was huge. We were in Rome during record breaking heat for a week, and the hotel was well air conditioned as well. It is in a mostly residential area and very quiet at night. The staff is small, and we had one good desk clerk while we were there - others did not seem to want to be bothered by too many questions. There is a small market around the corner from the hotel, otherwise most restaurants are a 5-10 minute walk. We loved it as our home base for touring Italy. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “They will overbook and not honor reservation if they can get more money”
Reviews.Author: fkd01
Reviews.Content: I had a room booked at Kolbe two months in advance. Then two days before I left for Rome they sent me an email saying my reservation was not confirmed because my credit card was no good. This was a lie my credit card was fine and could be used in Italy. They dumped reservation because they could charge almost double the rate I initially booked for. They manager was rude. I would not trust this hotel with a reservation, they will dump you if they can get more money.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Amazing Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HeatherHook
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is true that this hotel is not the easiest to get to from public transportation, but how often can you stay surrounded by Roman ruins? When we arrived, we were put into a street-level room which was very noisy. We had paid for a garden view room. The next night, they switched our rooms. The conceriege was helpful in finding local sites. The hotel is beautiful and elegant and comfortable. Breakfast was wonderful and tasty. It is close to everything - the Mouth of Truth is right around the corner. Overall it was a very wonderful stay. I just wish it had been cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Pengimo
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the airport in the evening and took around 40 minutes to get to the hotel, lots of traffic on the morotway. Was greeted warmly at the reception. Rooms were clean and quiet, adequate for our needs. Twin beds pushed together but comfortable and plenty of extra blankets and pillows in the cupboard. Shower was fine, nothing fancy, a little out of date but again adequate. Hotel was very quiet and restful. Breakfast was included and had lots to choose from. The best thing about the hotel was the staff. They were always helpful and polite and telephoned restaurants and taxis for us without a problem. Overall a really nice hotel within walking distance of the colosseum, around 25 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant find at The Forum”
Reviews.Author: ccmd
Reviews.Content: We are happy to give this hotel a good review. We found it on Splendia, the boutique hotel site the day before arriving and had fingers crossed that it would be as nice as the photos. When we arrived in Rome at 7am after an overnight train from Venice, we took the Metro to the Colloseum stop and made the 10 minutes walk to the hotel. We were exhausted and just seeing the lobby, everything so clean and modern was a treat. After traveling through Italy and knew that sometimes 4 star hotels are more like a 2.5 star. Hotel Kolbe was a 4 star. We were there to see the sites so we did not spend much time in the hotel but the room was lovely with well appointed furnishings and a very comfortable bed. We paid 99euros/night ($130 USD) on Splendia.com-an absolute steal for a contemporary hotel in a major European city.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ckf62
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel, it's location (even though it was a bit of a walk to any restaurants or bars), check-in and out staff were superb. Only disappointment was that I don't feel a guest should have to pay for internet. Especially if they use the public computer in the registration area.

Reviews.Title: “My prison cell”
Reviews.Author: barbexpat
Reviews.Content: Room- was on the ground floor -modern - clean -wardrobe (9 hangers) -mini bar-safe-no drawer space -but shelves (too high for me to reach ) Bed -looked king size - was 2 singles pushed together (sheets were not changed in 4 night stay -hole in top sheet was visable for whole visit ) Bathroom -modern -clean - but shower over bath with its many jets /sprays not a great idea as bathroom flooded if they were used Back to the bedroom - window was some 7foot off the ground -I could only see out standing on a chair -and there were BARS at the window -no idea how we would get out incase of fire Hotel staff were friendly -seemed to all speak some English Breakfast -fine -got very busy at the weekend Restaurant -in the evening was very expensive so we went out Advice - bring comfortable walking shoes - apart from the "ruins " there is nothing in the area !

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience - Overall Good”
Reviews.Author: journeyman29
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Arrived and got a double room (room 218) which was small and had a tiny bed (4 foot wide)...no room for lockers on both sides, so only had one locker. No bath in the bathroom - just a shower cabinet with a powerful shower...so powerful that the shower tray could not drain quickly enough and overflows Returned to reception and asked for a switch which I was told was not possible as the hotel was full on our first night but that they would make a switch the next day. We were switched the next day...and what a difference. We were moved to our new room (Room 115)....a reasonable sized room with a king size bed and a huge bathroom including jacuzzi bath and 'rain' shower, and doors opening onto the hotel garden. I have no doubt this was probably a 'superior' room and give credit to the hotel for making up for the experience in Room 218. However the point is that there are vast differences in the rooms in this hotel which could affect anyone's stay. The location of this hotel is also subjective. It is right next to the roman forum...but on the other side of the Capitoline Hill from the city. The most direct route to the city centre therefore involves scaling the Hill each time. Obviously you can walk around it but for the elderly or infirm I certainly could not recommend this hotel for location/ access. The nearest Metro station (circo massimo) is a 5-10 minute walk and there is no tram stop nearby Breakfast was the best we had on our Italian trip, which in itself is not a major compliment. However, there was a limited range of hot food - scrambled egg, sausages (actually mini hot-dogs), and streaky bacon - as well as the usual range of jucies, cereals, fruit, tea/coffee etc. Overall, we had a mixed experience - probably positive in the main - with a beautiful room for 2 nights, decent breakfast, and good service, coupled with the fact that we are both mobile and had no real trouble with the pretty inaccessible hotel location

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and had everything correct”
Reviews.Author: Bn1_Jon
Reviews.Content: Great location next to the Forum. Quiet, clean, efficient and friendly. Breakfast in the garden terrace each morning was great. Have stayed in much worse for much more money. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just back - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidg6
Reviews.Content: just back from three night trip Arrived into FCO and got express train, underground and then 10 min walk - all very easy. Hotel is very quiet and with great beds we had great nights sleeps. Very clean iand pretty hotel. Breakfast ideal, coffee machine was brilliant We ate in nearby Transterve every night, too much choice and very reasonable. Being a man the price of beer was important to me ! - no more that 4Euro for a large bottle of Peroni or a large draft. Wine also very reasonable. Food was excellent. Cany wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Kolbe - fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tapiocapudding
Reviews.Content: In a really good location, this is a great hotel. Very well presented - lovely decor, great design and impecable housekeeping standards. Every element of this hotel - the welcoming foyer, the well presented bar and restaurant, the roof terraces (one small, one large), the gorgeous gardens, and the lovely rooms - is just spot on. And while it is true that this place looks great, and is in an ideal location for sightseeing....what really makes this hotel a total gem of a place to stay, are the people who work there. Every member of staff we came into contact with, even those we were just passing in a corridor, would greet us with a warm hello and a smile. The front desk staff made sure we had all the information we needed for our stay in Rome, and would always bid us a friendly farewell as we left the building, and greet us with a warm hello on our return – and they were not one bit over the top, just really pleasant. We felt at home from the moment we arrived. The front desk staff, the breakfast staff, the bar staff, the restaurant staff, the housekeeping staff – they were all extremely professional, helpful, friendly and charming....10 out of 10! An absolute treat....a great place to relax and unwind....this is a really lovely hotel! P.S.... Nearby: The hotel doesn't have a swimming pool, but it is only a short walk to a public access outdoor swimming pool (summer months), near the colosseum: All’Ombra del Colosseo http://translate.google.co.uk/translate?hl=en&sl=it&u=http://www.allombradelcolosseo.it/&ei=gHaFTPSIKouk4QbV6pHjAw&sa=X&oi=translate&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CCcQ7gEwAA&prev=/search%3Fq%3DAll%25E2%2580%2599Ombra%2Bdel%2BColosseo%26hl%3Den%26rlz%3D1R2TSEA_en-GB and for other pools nearby, try www.swimmersguide.com Nearby: There is a lovely little deli around the corner from the hotel. A great place to pick up bread, meat, cheese, soft drinks, wine, beer, etc, to have as a picnic during the day. To get to the shop/deli, turn right out of the hotel, and left at the bottom of the road. Although, you won’t feel much like buying food when you leave the hotel in the morning....the breakfast was very tasty, and there was plenty of it. Also: Found this website for info on Rome, and thought it was very good www.lifeinitaly.com/tourism/lazio/rome-events.asp

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: jlieb
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at this lovely Hotel. Ideal location for all the major sites. The room was lovely and the air conditioned room was a welcome relief from the heat. Lovely staff, nothing was too much trouble. The breakfast was more than enough, bacon, eggs, pastries, cold meats and cheese, cereals, fruit and it was enough to keep us going until a meal in the evening. We ate at the hotel one evening, it was so nice sitting outside in their lovely garden, the food was delicious. The other evenings we walked across the bridge (ponte palatino) to the Trastevere region (only 10 mins walk) where there were endless amounts of eating places and mainly had the menu of the day from 10-17 euros a head for 4 course meal - excellent value and so tasty. The hotel will give you a map. We took our water bottles out every day and found plenty of water fountains to refill the bottles - all drinkable water. We spent the first couple of days on a hop on hop off tour bus, so it showed us where all the major sites were. The bus stop for these buses are only 5 minute walk from hotel - as you come out main door, turn right then go to the end of the road (there is a little cake shop on the right as you get to the end of the road, and they sell lovely icecream) you turn right at the end of this road (there is a little shop on the right as you go down the hill where they sell water, go down hill then at bottom of road turn to the left and cross this road, carry on along this road and you will see the bus stops - there is a little store selling drinks and ice cream but bit expensive - best to get water from little shop. Hope to return soon - it was so lovely

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel with efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: Romano127
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kolbe for 3 nights. The room was excellent with a very comfortable sofa bed on the ground floor and two singles on the mezzanine floor. Each floor had its own TV and air conditioning. We asked for a quiet room and when we arrived the staff had allocated a top floor room overlooking the garden which was fantastic. My wife is quite particular about hotel rooms but was more than happy. The location is great for the Colosseum, Roman Forum and Piazza Venezia. It's a 15 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain area. Just around the corner there's a really nice delicatessen which also sells sandwiches, drinks, etc at very reasonable prices. If you're travelling to and from the airport, don't forget there's now a maximum charge for the official Rome taxis to and from the centre of the city: £40 for Fiumicino and £30 for Ciampino. Check with the taxi driver beforehand as they may try to charge you more. We were recommended the Ciao Roma tourist bus service by the hotel. It was ok, but there are a number of these companies which let you get on and off around a circuit of central Rome and we found other companies provide a more frequent service. Just look out for the bus stops and there will be a guy selling tickets for a range of operators - have a look at the routes and prices before you buy.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Gertrude01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kolbe Hotel in August 2010 with my husband and 2 teenage daughters. It was a great experience. The level of accommodation is really very nice, not only in the lobby but also in the rooms. It was a great place to come back to periodically during the day to recharge and cool off. We had the junior suite, which was one spacious room with a round bed and a comfortable sofa bed for the kids. The beds were comfortable, and the room was very quiet, despite facing the street (and part of the Palatine Hill). There is a charge for wifi but it is quite reasonable. They have different options but I think it was around 5 Euros for an hour, and the hour could be made of up multiple log ons over multiple days. The breakfast buffet, included in the price, was generous and delicious. Service throughout was very good. Air conditioning worked great. We also appreciated the location, which is very close to the historic center but tucked away from the noise. We found it easy to get around on foot most everywhere, just taking the bus once to get to the Vatican museum. There are lots of restaurants within a reasonable walking distance, in nearby Trastevere or even 2 around the corner. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Guilia06
Reviews.Content: An excellent place to stay. We already did recommend this hotel to friends and collegues.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - close to everything but also quietly tucked away behind the Forum”
Reviews.Author: nellamay
Reviews.Content: A great hotel to stay in. Location ideal - 10-15 minutes to walk to Colosseum, Trastevere, Capitolane. Room very small but perfectly adequate. The weather was really hot but the air con. was great. My room looked out onto the garden which was lovely and peaceful. Breakfast is included and is excellent. You can fill up and not need to eat for quite a while (watch out for the pigeons though who will try to steal your food if you're not at the table!). Service was great. I had booked an internet deal when I booked the accommodation - this is cheaper than the pay per day option (but only of value if you're using the internet each day). I was given an additional 2 hours on my check-out day as my plane didn't leave until late afternoon which was nice as it allowed me to have a shower before checking out. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone for the excellent location and service.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EUROPEAN HOTEL SHORT WALK TO "EVERYTHING" IN ROMA”
Reviews.Author: rjr2010
Reviews.Content: From the front desk to the kitchen and bar, the staff at Kolbe Hotel were excellent! As close as you can stay to the Palatine hill and the Forum. We had our 2 and a half year old with us and it was a great time. Little restaurants and a tiny market just around the block and everything is close by. Though on a "side street" that borders the ancient ruins [you're that close] this hotel offers easy access to many ancient sites in an easy walk. Clean, comfortable, food was great [huge breakfast] and the staff were really nice. They will call for a cab and within 5-6 minutes you can be on your way. Half hour to airport [early AM]. The only drawback is that if you have a baby or toddler stroller, walking the city block on bumby cobble stones is tough... but that goes for any of the ancient locations - where the cobble stones are everywhere. Once you are on the paved side walk [a block away from the Kolbe hotel entrance] you're fine. We actually donated our new stroller to the hotel that we had shipped into the Kolbe prior to our arrival. Like all European hotels, there is a touch of "Spartan style", but really... this is a nice place to stay and is very quiet beside the ancient ruins.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikkizenner
Reviews.Content: Positives: The location was just on the other side of the Roman Forum, which is quite interesting. The Coloseum is close, but you have to walk around the Forum to get there. A map can be deceiving because it looks like you can cut across when you cannot. Everything was clean in our room upon arrival and every day we returned from site seeing. The rooms are air conditioned and they work very well, which was a plus because it was hot! Breakfast was good and had a nice selection. You can chose to sit inside or outside. Negatives: The hotel is rated 4-stars, which was a bit surprising upon arrival to our room. We had a triple "suite" which was relatively small. Room service is VERY expensive. They charge 6 Euros per person to deliver room service, which is a bit ridiculous! We also needed ice and we had to go down to the bar to get it, otherwise they would charge us as well. For 4-stars they were not complimentary in that respect. They wanted to charge us 20 Euros (which receptionist thought was a "deal") for internet, which I found absolutely ridiculous when it is 4-stars and with the amount of money we were paying for the rooms. Additionally, one would expect nice plush/goose down pillows and comforters, but they lacked those. I would recommend staying here if you do not mind walking or taking taxis. Otherwise stay somewhere a bit more central or that has easier access to public transport. Overall it was nice, clean, and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - we will be returning”
Reviews.Author: Jim186302
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Rome and a 4 night stay at the Kolbe. Check in was quick and easy and the staff were very friendly. The room was comfortable and the bathroom was very clean. We took advice from the review of another traveller and emailed the hotel in advance of our trip and asked for a quiet room - we were given a room at the rear over looking the garden which was quiet and had a pretty outlook. Breakfast is very good - there is an excellent choice of food from cooked through to pastries, yoghurts and a vast array of really fresh ripe fruit. The hotel is ideally located in old Rome, with the Forum practically outside the hotel door. The hotel is near to the Colosseum and is in easy walking distance of al of the main sights - it was lovely to wander through the back streets to get to Vatican City, Piazza Navone etc. The hotel ha a lovely bar and perhaps the only negative is that the drinks are fairly pricey - however this really isn't a problem with so many cafes and restaurants nearby and within easy walking distance. We found many lovely restaurants in the Traveste region where you could get great tasting pizza, pasta wine and beer for two and still have change from 15 Euros. It's fun to eat at the Piazza Navone - but much more pricey. I would certainly recommend that you take anti mosquito spray or cream with you - especially if you like to sit in the garden at the Kolbe after returning from a long day of sightseeing in order to avoid being munched...if you do get munched the pharmacist in the nearby pharmacy is very helpful and is able to sell the perfect cream to treat the bites !! When we first got to Rome we took the Terra vision bus from the airport - there is a ticket booth just to the right as you go through to the arrival lounge after collecting baggage. The ticket price was very reasonable - for us 8 euros per person for a return ticket. The bus leaves from just outside the door of the airport and takes you to the station. We then took a taxi to the hotel - I suspect that we probably paid more than we should have done and you certainly need to negotiate a price and be firm. However on reflection I think that taking a taxi was worthwhile and ensured that we got to the hotel without too much hassle. On the way back we actually walked from the hotel back to the station to catch the bus - its a good 40 minute walk at a fairly brisk pace. On arriving at the station its quite hard to find the terravision departure stand - you need to walk through the station main entrance, head to the left and turn right out through the door. You will see the terravision cafe and the booking office is inside - the leaflet doesn't tell you that you need to get a pink booking card from the office before you stand in the queue. All in all we thoroughly enjoyed our trip to Rome. We have fairly high expectations from hotels that we stay at and are pleased to say that the hotel ticked all of the boxes and met all of those expectations - the Kolbe is certainly a hotel that we will return to when travelling to Rome again and we would have no hesitation in recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: drfi007
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms were clean and well maintained. The bathrooms were lovely - the power shower was great! The rooms were small, but being in Rome, you don't spend much time in there anyhow. A good 4* standard. Wifi access was 20 euros for our entire stay, which was very reasonable. The best thing about the hotel is the location. Many hotels in Rome are in termini, which is a good walk from the majority of the sites. From our hotel, we could walk to the Colosseum, piazza navona, pantheon etc within 15 minutes. Also, there was a metro stop about 5 minutes walk away, which is about 2 stops from termini (where you can catch the express train to the airport). We only ate in the hotel restaurant once (probably because it was very expensive!), but I had the most enjoyable meal of my entire trip. The service was second to none and the quality of the food was fabulous. Good wine too! Definitely worth a visit. Excellent reception staff - very knowledegable. A few general tips, which I wish I knew before going to Rome. BEWARE of taxis. A 60 euro cab ride from termini to the hotel (about 2 miles max) left a sour taste for the rest of the holiday (but a positive thing was that we never got in a taxi again for the whole holiday, and I arrived home feeling very fit!). A quick google will reveal that this is a big problem in Rome, and I won't waste time by telling you all the various tricks they use on tourists to rip them off. Sometimes agreeing a fare in advance won't even help. Basically, if you stay in a hotel in the centre (like this one), there should never be any need to take a taxi. Eat in trastavere. The food is much cheaper and of a higher quality than in those restaurants close to the main tourist sites. Get a tour guide for the vatican. Ours was 40 euro a head, but the guide was fantastic (and well versed in the local history) and we skipped the 2 hr+ queue to get in.

Reviews.Title: “Cobblestone Streets...noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: Jess2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kolbe for 3 nights in May. Very retro style hotel. Our room was small and the temperature in the room was difficult to control, it would be freezing cold and then hot!! The bathroom was nice, big sink, magnifying makeup mirror with lights was a nice feature, big shower, complimentary slippers in sealed clear bags. Our room faced the front, so we heard the traffic all night long as it drove on the cobblestone street..... We were not aware of the courtyard rooms, would definitely do that next time. Front staff was very helpful and spoke English plus several other languages. Too bad about having to pay for WIFI. Loved the breakfast in the mornings. Ample closet space for hanging clothes and lots of shelves for putting socks/underwear etc. away. Dining room staff were nice. Location was good.

Reviews.Title: “So much promise, so much disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: xxijs
Reviews.Content: How they think that such poor service is acceptable for a hotel of this statue is beyond me! After spending a wonderful time in the gorgeous beach resort of Sperlonga, my wife and I were looking forward to spending a few days in Rome, sightseeing and enjoying the promise of the Kolbe Hotel. I have to agree that the hotel is ideally situated, but that is the only positive thing I can say about it! Being one of 4 or 5 parties kept waiting for over an hour to check-in is one thing, but the total lack of professionalism/care and attention demonstrated by the staff is beyond me. It didn’t get any better after finally reaching our ‘Deluxe’ room. A non smoking room that smelt of stale cigarettes, a swanky massage chair that didn’t work, a leaking Jacuzzi bath with a broken motor, dangerous light sockets where the atmospheric lighting should have been and distinctive smell of damp! We’ve learnt the hard way that an impressive website doesn’t necessarily mean that you are going to enjoy your stay! It’s just a shame that The Kolbe can’t learn their own lessons about what good customer service looks like.

Reviews.Title: “worst, most unfriendly and unprofessional reception staff/management that I have encountered on my honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: beeChelmsford
Reviews.Content: On arrival was amazed to discover that my pre-paid booking( made over 10 months ago) was not registered and was greeted by an arrogant and uncaring male receptionist who asked us to take a seat and wait. This turned into a farcsical hour- long wait , with no member of staff even saying hello ,eventually resulting in us being shown a room that they claimed was an upgrade, but having already paid and booked my honeymoon last year 2009, I knew that it was the grade I had booked myself.It was as if they thought they were doing us a favour! Having gone out to sightsee, we came back wanting to share an intimate night in our so-called romantic, unforgettable room-they must be joking! I ended up a bride sitting in a corridor on my honeymoon , as the jacuzzi, spotlights and massage chair all didn't work in the room and I wanted another room and at 470 euros per night I should damn well think so! We were shown a tiny room, so dark that it was obvious no one had ever accepted the room as an alternative...some 3 hours after first trying to run a bath we were shown a mezzaine room because my husband went to reception to tell them that I was by now crying in a corridor in a gown on my honeymoon. A young female receptionist ()who had begun her shift )overheard our poor exprience of a so-called high quality hotel and took pity on me!!!!!!! Not once did management apologise and as yet I have not had a repsonse to my leaving comment card. As an aside, we also stayed at Hotel Marcello in Rome near to the train station with a rooftop bar and were treated wonderfully and all for only half the cost of the pretentious and self important , unatmospheric and sterile Kolbe. HAVE NEVER WRITTEN A REVIEW BEFORE BUT THIS HOTEL REALLY DID DISAPPOINT AND WASN'T THE ONLY GUEST WHO FOUND THE STAY "UNFORGETTABLE !"

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Kaneohe_123
Reviews.Content: I too chose this hotel after reading the reviews here, and with only two small exceptions, our stay was fantastic. The location is across the street from the Forum, but the actual entrance is a short walk away. Rome is a walking city, but everything you need is within a 20-30 minute walk. We used some buses, and the front desk was very helpful in giving us directions. From the Coluseum it was about a 20 minute walk. Walking is actually easier than it seems by looking at a map. It's not as far as it looks. Based on other reviews, I asked for a garden view room, and it was very quiet. Our room was a junior suite, with the bathroom, sofa, TV, and desk downstairs, and just a bed upstairs. Apparently there are two types of Jr suites - one like ours with gargen view and two levels, and one where it's on one level but facing the road (which cold be noisy). The breakfast was included, and had everything you could ask for - pastries, eggs, bacon, sausage, fruit, etc. They will even make eggs at your request (the buffet eggs had milk so we asked for pure egg), even like sunny side or other requests. They even provided gluten free bread. It made for a wonderful start each day and with all the walking you'll need energy! WiFi rates were also reasonable, and there was even an "all stay" rate of 20E (for the duration of your stay), but I don't know who would be staying in their room enough to make full use of that with all the beauty of Rome to see! The only two things I was disappointed with was the fact that I had to call three times to get an iron, and when we arrived the room was cold. We tried to raise the temperature, but it wouldn't get warm, so we called the front desk and they adjusted it from there. Apparently, as is common in Europe, they limit or shut off the A/C or head seasonally, and you have to request them to change it. In this case we had to ask twice to get a comfortable temperature. Another good point is that it's only a 15-20 minute walk to Trasevere, across the river, where there are literally hundreds of restaurants to choose from. Try to check out the piazza in front of the Santa Maria church where this hilarious European-style mime who plays there at night. We saw him about 10 PM but I'm sure he's there quite a bit. But back to the hotel, dispite those two minor points, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and patio!”
Reviews.Author: Ev.M.A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Kolbe Hotel in May to visit the city before attending a wedding in Orvieto. Having been in Rome twice before I must say this hotel is well above standards. Perfect location to explore the city; you can walk everywhere and take breaks (from all the walking) during the day. At night, a couple of nice restaurants around the corner (tried InRome Restaurant) if you wish to go local. Otherwise just 10 minute walk accross the river (with great views) into the Trastevere. Rooms were not luxurious, but they were clean, quiet and with really nice bathroom. Complimentary drink upon arrival and breakfast in a lovely patio (also recommended for a glass of Prosecco in the evening). The staff were nice and they let me use the Internet for free on the last day. I would definitely go back to Kolbe.

Reviews.Title: “Expected Much More”
Reviews.Author: dancer784
Reviews.Content: After reading the overwhelmingly positive reviews about this hotel, I decided to stay here with my family during our recent trip to Rome. Frankly, I was disappointed. Perhaps my expectations were too high given all the excellent reviews this hotel received. Let's start with the location. On paper, it sounds great. The hotel faces the Roman Forum (the back of it really). However, the entrance to the Roman Forum is actually on the other side, about a 15-20 minute walk from the hotel, which is not too bad but I expected it to be significantly closer to the hotel. The other main attractions are also within walking distance (except the Vatican) but it's a good 20-25 minute walk to them, again not nearly as close as I thought they would be to the hotel. The cobblestone streets don't help much either. Secondly, even though the hotel is pretty clean/in pretty good condition, it could use a renovation/revamp. The hotel/ furniture is dull and simple. It's definitely not an elegant/fancy hotel. The rooms were the most disappointing. We stayed in a family/quad room. The ceilings were high, giving the illusion of a spacious room, however it's anything but. The bathroom was small considering it's intended for 4 people. The beds were sofa beds not actual beds. Two sofa beds were placed opposite each other, with a headboard separating them. There was no real living/sitting area. There was a small table with only one chair. Really? For a room that is intended to be used by 4 people? Overall, the design of the room was not very practical or functional. For the price and 4 star rating, I expected much more from this hotel. There are better places to stay in Rome. Pros: Good breakfast (hot and cold) and service at front desk

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - but...”
Reviews.Author: NJGNewcastle_England
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel that ticked all the boxes except one. First off a very good location, we were there for four nights & the only time we used any transport was to get to & from the station - we walked everywhere our furthest point being the Vatican which was around a 30 minutes walk. Hotel was clean, breakfast was good, evening meal seemed expensive but we were never going to eat there - make sure you sample a restaurant in Trastevere which is just over the river. The only negative about this hotel was that they took in a delivery at 5 in the morning and the trolley was wheeled, along the cobbled street, past our window. We should have complained earlier & they offered to move us but it was too late. All in all a decent hotel but make sure you request a room at the back of the hotel. A final word of warning - we got a taxi from the station & the meter was flying around - he tried to charge us 60 euros for a less than ten minute journey - we ended up paying 17 euros after some help from the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: davidcjoy
Reviews.Content: Geart location. The staff was the best. The court yard with orange blossoms.The great restrant.I just can't say enough good things about these people.They made our vacation wonderful.The best location of any hotel in Rome, and everyone speaks perfect english!

Reviews.Title: “A little oasis”
Reviews.Author: lovegreece_10
Reviews.Content: I was sorry to read "stay here at your own risk". We also stayed last week in April our experience couldn't have been more different. I booked 2 junior suites and we actually got exec suites overlooking the garden. The room was very quiet, we even left the window open at night. The bed very comfy and the sitting area gave us room to chill out after a long day sightseeing. We found staff very friendly. There were a couple of restauants within 3 mins walk, just turn left outside the hotel and follow your nose. We ate in 2 nights because the food and service was so good, far better than we expected. I found the hotel easy walking distance to most places and got used to having to dash accross then road and hope we didn't get hit! I did waht previous reviewer did and walked around the back of the vatican to the museum and sistene chapel. We went just as it was closing so went straight in. We could look around at leisure without the crowds. All in all a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “kolbe hotel was just perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: seasonedtraveller011
Reviews.Content: Oh dear for the last review did you actualy like Rome!!! I have been all over the world travelling in every star class of hotel and was not in the least bit dissapointed in the Kolbe. Yes I would use the Kolbe hotel again and would recommend to famillies and friends of all ages and abilities as has a lift to every floor and our room was spacious enough for three people. Ok we did not eat there why would you? (Too many places to explore outside) Any way the Kolbe hotel staff where polite and very knowledgeable nothing was too much trouble. The hotel is clean and we had no troubles what so ever. I travelled with two other ladies and we are varying ages from 40 to 52 the walking around Rome is safe and the distances no worry at all in fact we where amazed how quick we arrived everwhere (complementary map from the hotel) What fun we had in Rome the sights are amazing but busy at any time of the day. Word of warning about the Vatacian unless you are in a tour group expect to be waiting in a crowd up to 2 or three hours Im not jokeing. One thing you could try is if you where looking at the vatican from the front of ST Peters square go to the right hand side and follow the wall around the vatican untill you find the back entrance and get in for 15 euros each this will give you entrance to the vatican museum and the Sistine chapel leave your selves at least two hours to see everything. Go down side roads and you will be amazed at what you see hear and smell the Italians are so friendly I asked one Older gentlneman where I could find a shop localy as he was carrying a bag of milk and bread he spoke no English what so ever but with a little pointing we understood each other and left each other with a smile. Look at Eating out prices and if the place is busy it is usualy a good sign especially if they are italians my friends and I had excellent two course meals for no more than £60 with drinks and tip and the service was excellent. We ate in the Jewish ghetto and also in Traverse which is a stroll across the river even in high heels. Please explore off the beaten track its such fun and you see so much more than just the tourist spots as we where three ladies travelling we found it to be very safe and hassle free. Bring a good bank balance as the shopping for clothes shoes jewelery hand bags is second to none and also another empty suit case to put everthing in!!!!!!!! Tips..... Get a taxi to and from the air port as you arrive fresh and hassle free the train and underground are packed and a little scary if you are not used to it one way the taxi cost 50 euros but split three ways not so bad the train and metro cost us 48 euros one way and we had a long walk from the metro station with luggage to the hotel. Everything is closer than you think. Bring comfortable shoes. Dont be afraid to go off the beaten track and explore you can not get lost. Enjoy. Well done to the Kolbe hotel pat your selves on the back!!!!! And thank you for your use of the internet and assistance in printing out our boarding passes at no cost what so ever well done. Our trip was from 7/5/2010 till the 10/5/2010

Reviews.Title: “Stay at your own risk. 2 star hotel at 3 star prices”
Reviews.Author: mojodmonky
Reviews.Content: The wife and I spent 5 days in Rome the last week of April 2010 and we chose to stay at Kolbe based on the Tripadvisor reviews, the location and affordable price compared to other 4 star hotels. Maybe the junior suites are infinitely nicer than the standard rooms. Maybe other travelers/reviewers have different standards. Maybe every good review on TA is a fake review from someone associated with Kolbe. I'm not sure. But this hotel was arguably the worst experience I have ever had in my entire life. The good (not that there's much) Most of the staff spoke english fairly well which made it very easy to communicate. Although there isn't a whole lot in the areas immediately surrounding the hotel, if you dont mind walking a bit the location is actually very good. It is right next to the Palatine, Circus Maximus, and not that far from the Coliseum and many of the other sights/ruins. For food and drink, you can walk into the Trastevere area in about 15-20 minutes which isnt terrible. The walk to Campo di Fiori or Piazza Navona is also around a 15 min walk. All in all a fairly convenient place to be situated. The garden is very nice to relax and get a quiet moment away from the hubbub of the city (although it closes fairly early, 11pm i believe) The bad 4 star hotel? hahahaha laughable. To be fair, I haven't traveled that much outside of the US, but no legitimate establishment in the US similar to the Kolbe would ever consider themselves a 4 star hotel. Honestly it is a 3 star if not lower at best in terms of amenities, design, ambiance, service, room, etc... etc... The wife and I had come to Rome after spending a week in Barcelona where we stayed at what was advertised as a 2 star hotel (Hotel Constanza). The 2 star hotel in Barcelona wiped the floor with Kolbe on every level. That 2 star hotel in Barcelona felt like it was a W Hotel or some other higher end resort compared to the Kolbe. The staff at Kolbe were cordial but borderline useless. We asked for restaurant recommendations and the front desk was of no help. One thing we knew for sure was that we werent going to eat sub par overpriced food at the hotel restaurant. We had an early train to catch the morning we left and asked for a wake up call but never got one. Lucky (or unlucky) for us the rooms were so terrible that we had a hard time sleeping so we were awake anyways. When I went to check out and asked the front desk why we had not gotten our wakeup call, he just said "oh? it was in the system" Apparantly its too much to ask for an "I'm sorry" or any other type of apology. To be fair, all of the staff weren't terrible. The bellhop was very friendly and helpful (although he spoke very little english) and there was one younger gentleman working in the restaurant/bar who was also very friendly, helpful, and accomodating. Hotel cleanliness was an absolute joke. Now I am not a primadonna or one whos afraid of a bit of dirt here and there, but the room we were given was uninhabitable. Immediately upon entering the room, there was a very strong funk to it. At first I thought it was because the air wasnt on and it was somewhat of a warm day. I tried to turn the air on to get some circulation in the room but the air didnt work. Great. We didnt stay long in the room, only long enough to drop our bags and head out to find a bite to eat. On the way out I mentioned that the A/C was not working so they said they would look into it. When we got back after our meal, the odor was still very noticable. I changed into some comfortable clothes to relax for a bit, kicked off the shoes, and then went to use the bathroom. When I walked out of the bathroom I noticed that the carpet right by the door was damp. I leaned down and sure enough, that is where the smell was coming from. Upon closer inspection I noticed that not only was the carpet damp and smelly, but there were green spots on the carpet. I have to say that i was the first time I ever saw moldy/mildewy anything in a 4 star hotel. It would have been a surprise to see mold/mildew in the bathtub at a 4 star hotel, but on the carpet in the room itself? I called the front desk to tell them and they sent the bellhop up to investigate. Immediately he noticed the stench too and I pointed out the area of moldy carpet to him. He took a look himself, then called the front desk from the room. After a quick conversation in Italian, he passed the phone to me. The front desk notified me that they had another room they could move me to, but it was on the ground floor. No problem I said, since there wasnt much of a view in my current room anyways. I repacked my stuff and headed back to the lobby. So the ground floor room they showed us seemed slightly smaller, and the layout wasnt as nice, but all in all it seemed ok. We moved our stuff into that room and as we were unpacking I realized why the ground floor rooms are the bottom of the barrel. Now Via San Teodoro isnt a major thoroughfare but there is still quite a bit of traffic that comes by. The walls/window were paper thin and everytime a car drove by on the cobblestoned streets it sounded like the Indy 500. Furthermore, you could make out the conversations of every passerby walker who walked by the window. I called the front desk again and told them that the noise was unacceptable. Now its not like the wife and I are older people who go to sleep early, but the constant stream of cars and noise was fairly regular up until about 2am. Noise til midnight is fine. A little after that I can deal with. But at 2 or 3am its a bit much. So I asked the front desk to move us again, and they say they have no other available standard rooms. They said I could either stay here or move back to the moldy room I had come from. Seriously... they actually offered up that moldy room. Don't you think they would have closed it off and fixed whatever problem there was? So I was given the choice between potentially health hazardous mold or a noisy room that sounded like I was sleeping on the street. Did they offer to put us in a nicer room for no charge or even a nominal charge for the hardship? No chance. I guess though in their defense, they did send up a bottle of wine. Probably cause I had to be dead drunk in order to sleep through all that noise. So after we decided to stay in that room, we headed out into the city again. After a somewhat late night we made it back to the room around 2am or so and finally fell asleep around 3am. Since we didn't have anything planned for the next morning we thought we would just sleep in. Wrong. Even though we clearly had the DO NOT DISTURB sign on, we were awoken by loud knocking at around 9am. Half awake and groggy I didnt even bother getting out of bed, I just yelled out GO... AWAY! and the knocking soon stopped. Just as I was falling asleep again the damn phone rings and its the front desk. They are questioning who I was and what I was doing in the room. WTF? I'm a paying guest who was assigned this crappy room, that's who I was. Apparantly the evening shift associate forgot to update my information in the system. Talk about efficiency. Even when we werent being bothered by early morning phone calls or the incessant street noise, it was difficult to sleep because the beds were ridiculously uncomfortable. I prefer to stay at the W Hotel (or Westins) because I like their beds. I like them so much that I bought one of the W Heavenly mattresses for the bed I use at home. Now I cant expect to have that nice of a bed at a lower tier hotel, but being 4 star supposedly, I thought it might be close. The bed/mattresses at Kolbe were worst than some $199 mattresses you can buy at Ikea. I might as well should have slept on the floor if I wanted something that rigid and stiff. We endured this craptastic room for the next 4 days because we figured it would be too much of a headache trying to find another available room, rebooking, repacking, and moving hotels. For future travelers I would really think twice about staying at this hotel. If you do decide to stay, keep expectations low. This isnt a 4 star hotel, atleast not by US or Spain standards. It is 3 star at best, 1 star at worst. I have honestly stayed at Motel 6's that were as nice as this place. Now if the rooms were cheaper, it might be OK, but at $250/nt USD this was the biggest ripoff during my entire Rome visit, and as other travelers will tell you, the entire city of Rome is not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: wndrwmn
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the other reviewers. We chose this hotel because we got a good rate on Orbitz (around $120 a night, I think). The hotel was very nice, clean and modern. The staff were very helpful and spoke pretty good English. The complimentary city map was a huge assest! The breakfast each morning was good. The rooms were smaller than typical American hotels, but suited us fine. It is very close to the Colesseum, forum and Palatine Hill. However, it is a bit further from most everything else, including a metro stop. There was a bus stop relatively close by, but it was a little tricky figuring out the bus schedule. Overall, a great place to stay, but might have liked to be closer into town.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location for the ancient sights”
Reviews.Author: am123Canada
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in January. We wouldn't normally stay in such a posh hotel but we got a great deal on Hotwire, for 110$ CAD per night. It was a bit of a walk (45min) from the train station but we could have taken a bus. the reception area is really nice and the staff were helpful. The rooms are functional and clean but the bathroom is extra nice. It was only a 10min walk to the colosseum. Breakfast was more than what I would expect for a continental breakfast, with lots of fresh fruit, cold cuts, eggs, bacon, sausages, pastries etc... and was in their beautiful dining room which must be gorgeous in the summer. all in all, an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DecKen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Had dinner in the resturant on the first night which was really good. The staff are friendly and speak good english. We actually walked from termini station to the hotel (took about 30 minutes). The hotel is in a great location but if you dont want to walk around rome the double decker tourest bus stop is only 5 minutes away. You can use that bus to get around. The room was small but modern. I guess the only down side was thre was only 1 english TV channel (BBC world news) Woudl stay here again....

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel exceeded our high expectations in all ways”
Reviews.Author: Fidra1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights over Easter 2010. The staff all speak english well and can't do enough to help. We had a junior suite which had an ample living area and a lovely bed. Very nice bathroom with good range of toiletries and extras. The front of the hotel overlooks the Palatine area of the forum which is amazing, the back overlooks the hotel garden which is a lovely area to sit in the evening with a fountain and pond as well as citrus trees. There are tables outside to relax at too... it's hard to believe you are in the centre of room when you are in the garden. Breakfasts are buffet style and enormous, they are also available till after 10 in the mornings which is good for a relaxing start to the day. The only gripe we had was that the restaurant food in the evenings is rather expensive, however Rome is not cheap generally and we tended to eat out and about in the evenings anyway. The hotel is in easy walking distance of the Capitoline, the Forum and the Colosseum, Circus Maximus, Trevi Fountain etc etc etc are nearby too, however if the distances are too great, buy a daily bus/metro pass for 4 euros and hop on and off all day long. Buses are within a five minute walk. I will definitely stay here next time I'm in Rome, we can't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Rome in Spring 2010”
Reviews.Author: JimConHam
Reviews.Content: At the last minute my wife and I decided to take a short trip to Rome over her semester break. Although everyone offered an opinion of location within Italy little advise was shared about hotels. We turned to Trip Advisor to fill in the void on hotel information as we have done numerous times for Copenhagen, Paris, New Zealand and New York. The description of the hotel with the virtual tours and the Google mapping made the selection easy. Without a doubt it is the BEST location for walking tours in Rome. We were never more than 1.5 kilometers from anything except for the Vatican. Our advice would be to stay on the courtyard side for quiet or street side for view of the Palatine. After the first night the cobble stone auto noise disappeared.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing surroundings in the historic centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Canada1andonly
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming hotel and fitted out to a very high standard. We were very well looked after during a 3 day city break and the position of the hotel is right in the heart of the historic centre of Rome and withing easy walking distance of the Coloseium and Forum plus other destibations.

Reviews.Title: “The Kolbe Rome Hotel was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: mkzoomer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kolbe during our 20th anniversary trip. We booked the hotel through Hotwire and got a GREAT deal. The hotel was a little hard to find but once we got there & figured out how to get around, it was good. I recommend getting a taxi from the airport or train station. The closest subway is the Colloseo, but it is really tough to manuever through all of the cobblestone streets with luggage. The Kolbe is a converted monestary with a lot of the original architecture and the courtyard is beautiful. The hotel restaurant is top-notch and the staff is very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: socrmumx2
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. From the moment we checked into until we checked out, our experience was great. Our room was over looking the garden. It was clean, comfortable and quiet. If you stay at the Kolbe, ask for a room facing the garden. The location of the hotel is right in the center of the Roman ruins. The front of the hotel is facing the ruins. Breakfast is included with the room. It is very good. Eggs, fruit, the best croissants. Everything about the hotel we liked. The only set back was that there were't any restaurants near by. Everyone was very helpful, especially Favio.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: mumbergen
Reviews.Content: Have just returned home after four days in Rome. The stay at Kolbe hotel was almost perfect - excellent location, friendly staff and clean rooms. We especially enjoyed sitting outside in the garden under the beautiful orange trees sipping coffee, relaxing after a long day of walking all over Rome. We were first given a quite dark room below the ground level, but when we asked for a new room, we were promtly given a room on the first floor. A much better choice for us as it had a little bit of view to the back garden. The only thing we didn't enjoy was the quite hard madresses and the thin sheets on the beds. We are used to softer madrasses and duvets, but realize that this is not too common in southerns parts of Europe. The location of the hotel was great, even though we had to walk for 15 minutes to find restaurants nearby. However, the dinner we ate at the hotel was tasty with good wine and comfortable surroundings. We hope to return to this hotel and will recommend our friends to stay at the Kolbe hotel when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Stay”
Reviews.Author: JonnyMac_London
Reviews.Content: I have to say that this Hotel is one of my favourite. I can only think that this is my Top 2. We stay for 3 nights in one of the Junior Suites with an incredible space, jacuzzi, 2 flat TVs, very big and comfortable bed with an massive window. Very clean, all very organized and very helpful staff, they were very polite. They sure care about their guest. The breakfast was great with several options and very fresh fruits. Love the coffee Latte that you can prepare yourself as you like it. We had complementaries drinks one we checked in. Close to bus stops and 20mins walking to Coliseum, also if you don't mind walking, around 25mins to Via del Corso with loads of shops and restaurants. We had dinner in the Hotel and the Lasagne was beautiful Great Hotel, Great staff, Great location and Great Food. Very Well Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, wonderful hotel, fabulous time in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: lggreen55
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and its location. It was a very good value for the six nights we stayed in Rome. However, the room we were assigned was on the road side and was VERY noisy. The road is a one-way street, but the cobblestones make every car sound like an eighteen-wheeler passing by! The management could not give us another room in a quieter location for the same rate that we had so we tolerated the noise. I will go back to this hotel because everything else about it is wonderful. However, next time I will insist on a quiet location! The staff is very nice and accomodating and speak English very well. The rooms were nicely furnished and very clean. The bar and reastaurant is very good. I highly recommend the Kolbe Hotel Rome.

Reviews.Title: “I loved our room in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: poppyforever
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely, it's quiet yet still pretty central. The reception staff are nice and will give you a map of the area and tourist attractions in Rome. Our room was a superior one and it was a very good size with a lovely bathroom. We got a good deal, I suppose because it was low season. Breakfast was also very good, coffee, tea, cereals, bread rolls, cold meats, cheese and scrambled egg and bacon. Also there was fresh fruit and cold drinks. Restaurants are a little walk away, about 20 minutes, limited food places near the hotel. Bus stop close by.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo M
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during my honeymoon in 2008. I must say that our stay was perfect. The hotel is close to the Coliseum and is located ina very charming street in Ancient Rome. Already booked a new stay on my next trip to Rome in February!

Reviews.Title: “world travelers w/twin 10yr olds..christmas week at kolbe”
Reviews.Author: anniesfamilyoffour
Reviews.Content: Just returned 2 days ago from a week stay at kolbe. Not quite a 4 star by United States standards. Senior suite...2 bedrooms, 2 full baths(tub+shower in both), ground level facing courtyard with floor to ceiling doors that open to allow access to grassy area with lovely lemon and orange trees. A little nerve-wracking when the lock to courtyard door in both rooms could be pushed open....we were traveling with our children. The rooms offered privacy due to a very tiny entry way between the two entrance doors to rooms. Hard to describe...need key to access main door then opens into entry, then need key for each bedroom.
