Rooms were large by European standards, clean, minimally appointed to the point of being nearly austere . That's ok, don't care for clutter anyway. Each room had lcd tv, with only 2 English channels, no kid's programming in English. The kids enjoyed cartoons in German and Italien! DVD players NOT available from desk!! Bathrooms were decent size, clean, plenty of towels upon request. Slippers offered but NO robes :( ! Water was hot and plentiful and spa -like shower heads were a nice treat. No kleenex tissues available in the room. Heating needed to be activated by front desk, so just make the call. Room service was prompt and food hot. Caution ...room service hours are on Italien/island time! They do not serve prior to 7am...nor after 10pm..closed during odd hours during the day as well. Also, be advised, "bambinos menu" changed nearly every day...never knew what was going to be available for the kids. Something as simple as pasta with red sauce or pizza was actually hard to come by on some days...that was frustrating! The french fries were however available each day, hot and as yummy as fast food stlyle found in the USA. Prices ranged from 8 to 18 euro per item for room service. After a long day of touring, shopping, walking it was nice to order up a snack and curl up with the kids to plan the next day's adventure. Hotel's restaurant was pleasant as was the staff. Breakfast buffet was very well stocked. Coffee, latte, cappucinco, espresso, hot cocoa were all rich and delicious. Fresh, still warm pastries with chocolate inside, muffins, cakes all available each day. Sliced salami, proschutto, cheese,and mild ham were also available with multiple fresh bread options, rolls too. Yogurts, fresh juices, cereals also present. Serving time was reasonable...7am to 10am. If you have an early tour planned then ask front desk for boxed breakfast to be ready for your pre- 7am departure. no charge. Taxi service ...easy and quick. Prices ranged about 7 to 10 euro each way for trips to Vatican, piazza navonna, piazza barberinni etc. To make the return taxi trips easy we carried city map and pointed to hotel on map for so taxi driver would know our destination. Prices were always consistent, never got the impresion we were being "taken for a ride". We actually enjoyed the numerous taxi trips especially at night. Driving past the monuments and historical sites at night when all lit up was really something to see. For touring try Presto tours(AMerican guides) and rome's dark tours . Presto was great for a private Vatican tour, well worth the $. The Dark Tours group was excellent as well. The crypts, catacombs tour was amazing as was Masssimo, our guide. Day trip to Naples and Pompeii was good. Pompeii was really the place to see!! Colloseum morning tour was wonderful as well. I love to explore on my own but some of these sites are so vast that have a guide was a smarter way to go. Weather...ranged from 40 to nearly 60 daytime, cooler after sun goes down. Short bursts of light rain , just long enough to scurry into cafe for something warm, like a limoncello!!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable weekend”
Reviews.Author: TomNov2009
Reviews.Content: Great location- all interesting sights nearby. Wonderful rooms- very new and modern design. Staff is very friendly. Very good breakfast included. Tip: Try to get a garden view room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: lynnandwill
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. We had a lovely standard room which was larger than expected at the back of the hotel. We had requested this as previous reviewers had said it was quite noisy at the front of the hotel, and seeing the cobble stone road and the many cars travelling down it, I can quite believe it. The front desk staff were able to answer any questions we had and gave us maps and information. There was lots of choice for breakfast and we were more than happy - cereals, yogurts, bacon, egg, pastries, cheese, ham, fruit etc. The garden was lovely and we enjoyed pre-dinner drinks with complimentary nibbles. We didn't eat at the hotel as it seemed very expensive so ventured into Travestere for dinner where there are lots of typical Roman restaurants. But ladies - don't were high heels, the cobbles are hard to walk on! The hotel is situated by the Forum so is good for ancient Rome though further from most of the other sites. We did plenty of walking, to the Vatican, and further to the Piazza del Popolo (start of the Angels and Demons Tour - brilliant!) but you need comfortable shoes! But a taxi for two (which the hotel called for us) to the Vatican was just under 10 euros which we did one evening. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: davo2005
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Kolbe during our holiday in beautiful Rome. We had planned to stay in close proximity to the ancient ruins so the hotel was an ideal base for our day long excursions. The hotel is located beside Palatine Hill/Roman Forum and is a 5-10 min walk to the entry of either location. The Colosseum, Circus Maximus and the Mouht of Truth are of equal distance away. The hotel itself is beautifully presented and the rooms are very comfortable. It was nice to begin each day with breakfast outside in the hotel garden. Breakfast was excellent with a great variety of food. The pastries they served were probably the best we had during our trip in italy. Staff were very friendly and helpful. All staff members we dealt with spokle English well. We ate at the hotel restaurant a number of times as by the day's end we were too tired to walk to any nearby restaurants. The food was excellent, yet the menu was quite limited. There are a few restaurants down the road and many more in Piazza Campitelli and the jewish area which are no more than a 10-15 min walk. If you are a little more adventurous you can take a stroll over to Trastevere (10-20 mins). There are a few small stores/deli around the corner from the hotel which were very useful . I definitely recommend this hotel for those people who want to stay in a quiet and relaxing part of Rome, whilst being close to the ancient monuments rather than the piazza's etc. If you like to walk and explore the city you are visiting this is the hotel for you. A 10-20 min walk will lead you to all the sights, restaurants and amenities you need whilst in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: QueenRavena
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Kolbe. The staff was amazing, the rooms were wonderful. Best of all there are several delightful restaurants around the corner to accomodate either lunch and dinner. Our only small issue was that the beds were slightly hard...but then again, it's not home. We loved the quiet and the proximity to the Roman Forum. We highly recommend the Kolbe. It's delightful!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel near the Foro Romano.”
Reviews.Author: afmachado
Reviews.Content: At first, we were very angry at the hotel front desk because we paid for a superior room and they gave us a standard one. After changing rooms twice, everything was perfect. Good breakfast, elegant and friendly staff, confortable room and good location make this hotel a good choice in Rome. The neighboorhood is quite confusing to locate yourself as a tourist, but after one or two days, you find anything you want.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: dividendo
Reviews.Content: The facts: Very good location, complete breakfast included, nice rooms, all very clean. Internet is not included but they have the "all your stay" option for 20 euro which seems ok for 4 days. The feelings: Maybe my expectations were high coming from terrific hotel experiences in Venice, Regent Cruise and Istanbul. But i think that the staff in this hotel (particularly front desk) lacked the charm and candor of the other places. Net if you don't miss this type of attitude by all menas this is a sure bet while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean”
Reviews.Author: ECompton
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were very knowledgeable of the area and more than proficient in English. We traveled in August and the air conditioning was not super cold. The location was nice and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the Colosseo, Fori Romani, Trevi and Trastevere.”
Reviews.Author: LadyLindaT
Reviews.Content: This was a stylish and modern hotel. The room was very comfortable, and quite large compared to my previous experience of Roman hotels. It was well-equipped, with flat-screen t.v., hairdryer in the bathroom, etc. We were greeted very cordially and helpfully upon arrival. We had some fun and games with the room safe, which the staff sorted out very promptly and courteously. (It seemed to be on a bit of a hair-trigger!) Complementary maps were available at the reception desk, and details of tours and excursions were displayed in the lobby. Breakfast was quite plentiful, with the option of eating in the gardens, subject to a table being free. The location was very quiet at night, which, considering Rome's traffic, was a bonus. The air-conditioning was very efficient. It was a bit of a hike to get to the other obvious "must-see" locations in Rome, such as Piazza Navona and the Borghese Gardens, but it was still all do-able on foot if you don't mind walking. The hotel restaurant menu seemed very limited and expensive, so we didn't eat there in the evenings, which was a pity, as we would have liked to if the menu had been a bit more varied. There didn't seem to be anywhere else close by to eat, so we had to go back into "town" every night for dinner. We especially liked Trattoria Della Torre Argentina in Largo De Argentina for the mix of good food, friendly staff and lively atmosphere, as you could watch the world go by, and pretty much all of it did!.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: PedSolz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Kolbe in early September and were very impressed by the quality of the hotel (particularly for european standards). Not the cheapest but worth the money as the rooms were spacious (again in european standards), clean and modern. Staff were friendly and extremely helpful. Location was terrific, provided you enjoy beng close to the ancient Rome part of the city as it's located right next to the palatino. Walking distance to main tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: geomatic
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a two week stay in Italy for our honeymoon, first five nights at the Kolbe in Rome. Being new to Europe didn't know what to expect but was amazed by the quality of the hotel. I had only heard horror stories about cramped, dirty rooms in Europe for under $300 a night. Theses rooms are nice! The front doesn't begin to show the greatness of this hotel. There's nothing to look at except a tall (20ft)divider wall for cars and street parking in front. But inside it is beautiful. Very professionally decked out, service was amazing, rooms were very modern, comfortable w/ AC, and a nice bathroom w/ shower only, The breakfast every morning was wonderful w/ coffee drinks, cereal, meats, breakfast sand., etc., but the best part of the hotel was the court yard in the back where you can eat/lounge and the location! The courtyard is beautiful, you'd never think they had this much room from the front. Very refreshing in the morning or any time of the day/night. From what we saw around Rome this wasn't standard. Second, the location. We were able to walk within 10 min. to the beginning of the main road that leads thru the heart of Rome. You could be at the Pantheon within 15 min. to enjoy some wine at one of the most romantic places on earth. There's so much going on that you won't even notice how long it takes to walk anywhere, trust me. Then you are 5 min. from Palatine Hill and the ruins/Colosseum. I would recommend buying the double decker bus ride around town for 48 hrs. with jump on and off to use as main transportation while sight seeing, works great. Last but not least there are a couple of good resturants around the corner but most importantly a little food store with wine, deli meats/sandwiches, WATER, soft drinks, and snacks w/ a younger guy behind the deli that speaks very good English. Don't under estimate how important this is to be able to buy stuff for your room and daily needs as there aren't a lot of places to buy cheaper supplies. I will only stay here again in the future as I see no need to find anywhere else on our next trip back, which we will positively be back---ITALY IS WONDERFUL!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Location a bit far from the action”
Reviews.Author: Malatoria
Reviews.Content: The Kolbe was comfortable, and clean. Breakfast on the outside patio was enjoyable ,and was generously filled with most all you could want. Rooms are indeed clinical and high teck, though internet service was as usual (most of italy) useless! The hotel is quite a bit of the beaten track, and requires a vigourous walk to most of romes sites. I would still recommend this hotel, as it does offer good value for the price we pain through booking.com

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Holiday Italia!”
Reviews.Author: Sparkster777
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week, after our timeshare had moved us there from the previous location that was being renovated. After our red eye flight from the U.S. we arrived at 10:00 a.m. and were able to check in right away. We went right to the room and unpacked and decided to take a nap only to find we could not sleep because our room was right next to the cobblestone road and could hear every car tire going over every stone! We thought we could tolerate it, but with every car that went by we knew we couldn't last a full week in this room. So, we spoke to Elena at the front desk who promptly moved us to another room at the end of a hall facing the garden. No street noise whatsoever, and we slept soundly the entire week! The room was very clean and a little small, but we were only in the room to sleep at night. We were out everyday walking to the Colosseum, Cara Calla Baths, the Vatican, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, and as far as Villa Borghese. Or course the Palatine Hill was right across the street as well as Circus Maximus. We even walked to the Volpetti Deli (thanks Giada!) We ate dinner twice at the restaurant which was very good and fresh! The service staff was very friendly and helpful in our stay. All in all, we were happy once moved from the street side room and would certainly stay at the Kolbe again! BTW, we had a great time taking a Rome Segway Tour that we booked with Viator.com. Marco & Carlo were great & funny guides!

Reviews.Title: “Suffered a literal power failure: Horrible staff and manager who cannot make the hi-tech hotel work”
Reviews.Author: FredTravelVa
Reviews.Content: We were a family of five who paid for our Hotel Kolbe stay on AMEX points. At reception, we were informed by a surly woman (who kept smiling during all the bad news -- as if she enjoyed hammering us) that our request for the quiet back side of the hotel could not be accomodated. We arrived at 7pm, and we understand that rooms fill up . . . so it was off to the cooler for us . . . the basement (first floor) rooms. Our rooms were on the busy front of the hotel but felt like basement rooms. The only window was up high in the room and opened to the parking lot. I say "opened to" because the window would not shut all the way. So we would hear folks walking to their cars, foot traffick (our ears were at boot level, given the location of the rooms), etc. And traffic on that side of the hotel was noisy. The rooms are very new and clean -- and that is generally a huge plus for travellers. But this hotel is extremely hi tech. I am used to the European hotels where the room key goes into the wall to activate the electricity -- no problem. But there are a dizzying number of outlets and switches. Nothing is intuitively placed or labelled. During our first night, as we were in our beds, all of the power went off in our room while we were watching TV. Once we fumbled around, we were eventually able to get the lights to work in the room -- but ALL of the outlets were dead. When we mentioned this the next day, the manager told us that we had waited too long to bring it to his attention and that there was nothing he could do at 8pm at night to make the outlets in the room work. So there was no recharging our electronics. We asked for a price break or partial refund. We got nothing. The manager (who sits behind the blonde smiling lady who denies you everything) was horrible to deal with. We left early the next day and were never so glad to have left a hotel. This is a high-tech hotel that is brand new with a staff that has no clue, and worse, no motivation or desire to see that you have a nice stay. Until all the staff are fired, stay away. And you simply do not want the rooms that face the room; you will be better off in your in-laws basement apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the River Palace Instead”
Reviews.Author: dawsoniv
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel, but we weren't impressed. The front desk was checking on stuff for us and we had to remind them who we were every time. The rooms were small and showers unbelievably tiny and internet was not free. I stayed at the River Palace the next week and it was like night and day. The location is a bit of a hike too if you like to walk to attractions.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: sunnysuzanne
Reviews.Content: This was the BEST surprise of all the hotels my husband and I have stayed in during all of our stays overseas. The breakfast was superior. Evening meals, though pricey, were worth every penny. The service was outstanding and the room was beyond our expectation. The location, though a little hard to find at first, was perfect for walking trips around Rome. We will definitely choose this one on our next trip to Rome. Thank you Kolbe for an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: derbyshirenomad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly situated within the ancient quarter and a 10 minute walk from the capitolione piazza and also the roman forum. The hotel is very quiet, peaceful and a great place to relax after a busy day in the hot bustling city. Although there are limited restaurants around the hotel, only a 15 min walk will take you into the town centre where there is an abundance of eateries and the hotel are very willing to organise a local taxi to drop you where you wish. My partner and I stayed at the hotel in a junior suite. We had booked the room on-line via their website and had organised a mercedes cab for collection from the airport. The collection went well although the driver wanted more money than I had agreed with the hotel, though this matter was sorted after a short time. The room was large, spacious and clean although initially the tv, jacuzzi and massage chair didn't work. However after speaking to the helpful porter these were also rectiifed by the end of the day. Also the sink began to leak but again after a quick comment to the receptionist the matter was resolved. The staff were very helpful and assisted in booking a trip to Vatican City which included all the main sites and which avoided the queues. The hotel also provided a pack up breakfast for free for the trip. I have to say that the restuarant was brilliant. The setting is lovely and tranquil and i can not believe that we were in the centre of the ancient quarter and we couldn't hear a noise. The food was excellent though expensive which was predictable. I would highly recommend this hotel if you wish for peace and quiet with lovley garden surroundings. Though the issues with the room were a minor irritation considering its four star status.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Famluv2travel
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful start at the Kolbe Hotel of our Italian vacation. We stayed in Rome for five days. The family room was perfect for us and our two teenage daughters. They loved the fact that they had their own TV in their loft! Breakfast was wonderful! Near ancient ruins but quite a distance to the stores near the Spanish steps, but still walkable. The grounds were peaceful and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Booked 2 rooms; got 1”
Reviews.Author: Wide_Stance
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms through Expedia. When we arrived, they were all smiles and said they had a wonderful surprise for us. They only had one room, but it was a family room for all of us. Yeah! Seriously??? It was basically, a regular room with a pull out couch and bathroom on one floor and a loft upstairs with a bed. We whined about the bait and switch, but said they didn't have anything else. They said we could have 2 rooms the next night. Then they offered us a free drink. We didn't take them up on it, but eventually got them to give up a free dinner. They said we would have to work out the details with Expedia over the loss of a room for one night. I will say it was a nice room - we had the loft up top, so don't know how the 2 on the couch felt about it. The next night they gave us another family room, so we ended up both having family rooms. So, I thought it evened out and didn't contact Expedia for a refund at the end of the trip. The location of the hotel - while close to things like the Coliseum - is awkward to get to. It looks close on the map, but you have to walk around a lot of things to get to it from the metro stops. And the sidewalks are kind of non existent in parts of the walk, so you have to walk on the streets. Just as an aside about Rome. Someone in our party was pickpocketed on the metro right after we arrived from our long flight. These things could happen anywhere, so I'm not going to hold it against Rome. I would just suggest taking a taxi from the airport to the hotel. It may cost more, but when you're tired, it's your best bet to protect yourself from thieves who know you're wary and have your guard down.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel in the heart of the Ancient city of Rome”
Reviews.Author: FionapDundeeScotland
Reviews.Content: We recently had a 4 day stay at this lovely hotel which is approximately 10 minutes walk from the Colosseum and other areas of interest near the Ancient city. It is also approximately 10 minutes walk in the other direction to the Emanuelle monument, and lots of shops and restuarants and there are bus stops nearby for open topped tour buses. The hotel area is quiet, and the decor and furnishings are very modern, clean and comfortable. We had a family room which had a king size bed and a king size sofa bed which were clean and comfortable. There were two plasma TVs in the room, a mini bar fridge and a safe. The bathroom was lovely, with a jacuzzi bath and shower, toiletries and slippers! The room was cleaned daily to a high standard, The buffet breakfast had a range of foods for all tastes including cooked sausages, eggs and bacon, fruit, cakes and cereals. The waiters and waitresses were friendly and helpful and the lunch and dinner menu was good, and the prices were similar to restaurants, We had breakfast every morning which was always fresh. We had lunch on the last day which was very tasty and good value for money. The ladies who worked at reception were very professional and extremely helpful regarding places to go, directions, transport and general enquiries.

Reviews.Title: “Could Do Better”
Reviews.Author: NauticalCork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Building Great Location Rooms very comfortable Reception staff were less than friendly Only experienced the restaurant at breakfast. The food was very good but the staff were at best sullen or at worst rude and lazy. Their attitude had a very negative effect on an otherwise excellant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel! Minutes away from the Colosseum!”
Reviews.Author: Londoner1975
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel at the beginning of July. The hotel is fantastic! So beautiful with an incredible garden where to enjoy the best coffee in Rome and an amazing and authentic Italian food! Everything was perfect! It is just a few minutes from the Campidoglio and Colosseum, you can walk from there to anywhere, no need to catch any public transport. The staff is really friendly and helpful! I really recommend this hotel. It is so central but at the same time so peaceful and there is a special atmosphere there! I wanna go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “A big disappointment - not recommended”
Reviews.Author: MrsAW
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms here through lastminute.com. When we arrived, they only had 1 room for us, and told us that they were full. Firstly, they tried to get all 4 of us (adults) to share 1 room, which they called a suite - it was not a suite, it was a small room with a loft area, suitable perhaps for people with small children. After keeping us waiting in the bar (with a free drink) for over an hour, they eventually offered us 2 rooms, numbers 103 and 104. These rooms are on the ground floor, by the road. They are noisy, dark and cell-like. Take a look at the photos. In addition, room 103 has serious damage to the walls, and smells very bad. I would guess it has been flooded, or similar. Breakfast is fine if you arrive before 9am. After 9am, you will have to clear your own table to find somewhere to sit, and there is not much food left. This is not a well run hotel. We stayed for 3 nights, and were glad to leave. We also parked in the road outside the hotel, and got a parking ticket!

Reviews.Title: “luxury four star hotel in rome italy in the historical center”
Reviews.Author: sardinia2009
Reviews.Content: luxury four star hotel in Rome Italy, the best four star hotel we find during our stay holiday in Italy. this four star hotel in the historical center of Rome offers standard as 5 star hotel. Best location: face tyo face to the Forum Romanum. at walking distance from Trastevere, Colosseum, Piazza Venezia and many other important monuments. This four star hotel was opened on dec. 2007 and now in an historical building you find all modern comforts. the multilingual staff is very professional and friendly. We had all our dinners in the hotrel Restaurant "Le Jardin" in the garden of this four star hotel you have really the possibility to enjoy the unique location. Our room was large and very elegant, the bath room with Jacuzzi idromassage bath-tub. the price are really reasonable. best value for money. we will suggest this four star hotel in Rome to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “They made an effort”
Reviews.Author: jofolo
Reviews.Content: Nice Large room. The round bed would be avoidable but well equipped with latest tech but lacking an ipod dock and connection

Reviews.Title: “Totally unique - lush garden, quiet rooms, sophisticated decor.”
Reviews.Author: aboutmiami
Reviews.Content: First time to Rome (but previous year three weeks in Italy). This is in the Aventino area...The hotel was a totally unexpected delight from the moment we stepped foot in the door on arrival from the airport. Only a two minute walk from the Circus Maximus metro station, five minute walk to the Roman Coliseum - felt very safe walking here at night, across the street from Palatino Hill - the original city of Rome. Located on a quiet street near restaurants, near the river where you can walk under the shade of the trees, near shops and transportation. If you like to walk, you can actually take the map from the front desk, - they will show you the most popular route...and walk to all the most popular sites of Rome from this hotel. There is also a museum (?) "next door" which hosts free outdoor summer concerts. The hotel's decor is beautiful - Italian chic. Very sophisticated. This property looked brand new. I don't think the web site does this hotel justice. In an old convent with high ceilings in the rooms, huge windows, a park-like garden in the back with fountains, chirping birds, orange and palm trees, where guests can eat their breakfast and dine in the evening, or enjoy drinks from the bar. The buffet breakfast which was included here was overly generous. Hot and cold breakfast food, the best chocolate croissants Ive had in Italy! Breakfast staff was excellent and courteous. Dinner was a bit pricy for our budget, so not eat here at night, but the menu looked good. In all our walks around Rome we did not see a hotel that would compare to these amenities (regarless of hotel star-ratings), or one as quiet, or with a garden. The rate we paid was approx 130EU. In our humble opinion this was a steal. The staff is helpful and friendly, even under pressure with a full house of guests to deal with. They were full when we arrived and I'm sure as word spreads of the quality and value here, this hotel will always be full. We asked for an upgrade since we paid/booked well in advance and were given a huge corner room (#209?) overlooking the Palatino Hill. (We had no idea of the depth of history we were looking at until after we toured.) The bathroom was enormous and fully tiled with granite, marble, spa shower etc..was beautiful. No gratuitous, cheap artwork on the walls - just beautiful fabrics on the windows and bedspread (with very effective black out curtains). Spotless. We did notice our room was larger than others (we could see when the maids were making up the rooms down the corridor). So it is worth the upgrade, if available, to a superior double (not sure of what they call it). It would have been nice also to have a garden view. Did not work/did not like: Minor detail....The lobby internet connected, but jammed when trying to read email. Not sure what the problem was, but they did agree to remove that charge from the bill on checkout. Wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: gp171080
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of July and found the hotel to be very nice and clean with a fresh feeling to it. The reception staff were very friendly and our room was ready earlier than we had expected. Before I left for the trip I had contacted the hotel and requested a garden view room (on the advice of a review on here due to noise) and was pleasantly surprised when they had provided us with a garden room. This was nice as the doors opened up to the garden and you could sit outside. Our room was very clean, and larger than I had anticipated. The bathroom was a good size also. The only downside to the room was the fact that the TV has only two english channels which limited what you could watch when lounging in the room. There was also not much hanging space but we got by. The location is overlooking the Roman Forum and roughly a 10-15 mins walk to the Colosseum in one direction and a 20-25 mins walk to the Spanish Steps in another direction. The downside to the location is lack of restaurants. 5 mins round the corner there were two but not much variety. All in all a nice stay and would recommend this to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay! Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: KamaHele1985
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my aunt and my mother to Rome, and we stayed at the Kolbe Hotel for four nights. It is a fabulous property overlooking the Forum, which makes most attractions at a perfectly walkable distance. The room was very spacious and had a great view, along with a large bathroom, so the three of us had a very comfortable stay. The breakfast spread was delicious, with freshly baked goodies! The hotel staff was exceptionally friendly, and very cooperative. They helped us organise our onwards trip to Florence, and gave excellent recommendations for things to do in and around Rome. Their restaurant staff was perhaps the most hospitable I have ever come across. Our last night we decided to eat at their restaurant, and had brought along our own wine, which, as luck would have it, turned out to be a bad buy. The restaurant manager offered a lovely bottle of wine to cheer us up, on the house!!! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to have a pleasant trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Fusayachi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Kolbe in June. We found it on line and everyone indicated it was "perfect location". First off, it is a nice hotel, the nicest we stayed in during our 11 day trip to Italy. It was clean, the staff was friendly and it was a large room. The location is average. It is a decent walk to a few of the attractions. However, given the set up of Rome, at least one or two attractions will be a long walk. Because we were not on any time retraint, we walked everywhere... from the train station, to the Coliseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and even the Vatican. It's a little hard to find, but overall a nice place to stay in Rome. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: nkskjames1
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel that is very modern and clean. The family rooms for 4 are great. But the best thing about this hotel is the location. It is in the heart of ancient Rome. Also the breakfast was the best we had in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “fantaastic!”
Reviews.Author: tel21
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel. Nice and helpful staff. Very clean and comfortable rooms. Good location even that you have to walk about 10-15 minutes to the city center.A very good and rich breakfast is served in a very nice gardrn. It is amazing how in a city like rome the only sound we have heard was the birds in the garden. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, nothing negative at all!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa2327
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kolbe Hotel from the 8th to 12th June 2009. We booked it on the bass of trip advisor reviews and were not disappointed! The location is perfect, on the edge of the Forum, nowhere was too far to walk (even for me being 6 months pregnant). it is 2 minutes from Piazza Venizia and the Colosseum is less than a 5 minute walk. We were delighted with the location. The staff were all friendly, helpful and polite. The hotel itself it clean, well kept and has a lovely garden and terrace to sit at outside. The room was fantastic. A very large size for a capital city with great air con (it was 30 degrees and we needed it!) with a large, comfortable bed, great bathroom and all was very clean and brand new looking. the breakfast was excellent, a full selection of pastries cooked fresh, fruits, bacon and eggs, breads and toast, hams and cheeses and pretty much anything you might want. Even better as the outside terrace to enjoy breakfast in the beautiful gardens. IF you are after a centrally located, comfortable hotel with lovely modern rooms, then this hotel is perfect! i can't stress enough how much we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A True Roman Holiday Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sherrau
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a four night stay at the Kolbe in Rome. Our room was on the fourth floor overlooking the ruins surrounding the Circus Maximus and Colliseum. It's a short walk to the underground and many restaurants. The breakfast served each morning is first rate. The room is simple, clean and comfortable. The location is not central but in an interesting area for those who would like to walk through the ruins.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Hotel but 3 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: David-n-Kerry
Reviews.Content: We booked the Kolbe Hotel Rome after reading other reviews. We planned to stay 4 nights but checked out after just 3. Upon our arrival we were subjected to the usual trick by some European Hotels of offering us the worst room in the Hotel first, it had no view, other than the kitchen yard, was very small and had plaster missing from around the door frame. After complaining we were offered another larger room with a view of the Gardens and was perfectly acceptable. Several requests were made of the Front Desk staff during our stay all of which where ignored until chased up. They seemed to be short staffed and busy training new staff. The only decent service provided was by Elena the rest did not seem interested. The location was good but the Hotel had no atmosphere whatsoever, the Bar closed at 11pm and we hardly saw any other guests in there anyway. We had an early checkout and wished to place an alarm call, the young man on the Front desk who took our call hung up on us before we had chance to request a continental breakfast for 6.30am as the Restaurant did not open until 7am. So we rang back again and he very casually said no problem and hung up again, sure enough when we presented ourselves at 6.30am for the continental breakfast he had failed to pass this message through to the Kitchen Staff who told us nothing could be prepared. All in all a clean modern 4 star Hotel in a excellent location for all the City of Rome sites but let down by poor staff.

Reviews.Title: “Kolbe Hotel Rome- 6 star rating!!!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaMariaO
Reviews.Content: I went for holidays to Rome with my mother. It is hard to say in one sentence how happy we were after our holidays at KHR. Everything was so perfect. Great location, beautiful hotel sides, wonderful views from the hotel window... Excellent staff and their service! That was a special occasion for my mother and the stay was some kind of a gift. I contacted Kathrin and she put a lot of efforts to make it wonderful. We got a lovely and so clean room and Alessia from the restaurant with her very professional team made sure that our stay was also very tasty! ;) Reception staff was very friendly and helpful! We also had a massage session... That was just a great end of our journey. Francesco was very friendly and professional as well. We just loved the place and people working there! We will definitely come back to KHR!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Kolbe Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Northern_Neighbour
Reviews.Content: You won't be disappointed if you choose the Kolbe Hotel. We stayed there for 3 nights in May/09 and had an excellent time. The hotel is modern and the staff were friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and the a/c was strong and quiet. There was a lcd tv with the standard 2 English speaking channels (CNN, BBC), an in-room safe and minibar. They also provided new slippers packaged in plastic which was a nice touch. The buffet breakfast buffet consisted of fruits, cereals, breads, pastries, cheeses, cold cuts and bacon. The scrambled eggs were cooked properly and were not just steamed in a large pan like some other hotels that we stayed at in Italy. The hotel was very close to the ancient ruins but it was a fair walking distance to the other sites north of the ruins. Overall, we had a great experience and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Peace and quite in the heart of the city.”
Reviews.Author: Dazkiter
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Kolbe many times. Our last visit was May 17th to the 20th for four nights. The Hotel was fantastic as usual. The bedrooms are of good size. Ask for a room facing the garden at the back, even though the front rooms are facing a one way road, the noise from the cars driving over the cobbles can be a pain, but only if you go to bed EARLY and get up LATE and who is going to do that in Rome!!! When I have been in the front rooms in the past I had no problem as the road is quite at night and you have double glazing!!! The rooms are well decorated and clean with nice comfortable beds. Nice size bathrooms as well. The smaller rooms are on the ground floors which just have shower cubicles but I have stayed in these as well and they perfectly comfortable. Breakfast is great and sets you up for the day. If the weather is nice you eat outside in a lovely shaded area in the garden. The staff are very good and English speaking and they always help me with unofficial Italian lessons. Why do I stay here every time I go to Rome? Well it is JUST outside all the main points of interest and yes it can be a pain walking a WHOLE TEN minutes to get around the block, but what a block…. And the pay off is the peace and quite of the Kolbe Hotel. A good point to mention is to look the hotel up on Google Earth. See how for you are away from the main sites, take a note of them. Then go to lastminute.com. Look under secret hotels and go for the hotel which says it has Orange trees in the back garden and not far from the main sites (which you have taken notes from Google) then book it with a big discount!!! Have a great stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, upscale, well-managed”
Reviews.Author: Toonces
Reviews.Content: Located on the historic, quiet, cobble-stoned V. di San Teodoro, just a block from the Arch of Janus and Piazza Bocca della Verita, this is a beautiful, comfortable, modern hotel. The hotel's featured photo shows the back side, with a large, lovely garden and fountain, which many of the rooms view. The front faces the fenced southwest side of the Palatine Hill. The walk to the Circus Maximus metro is about 3/4 mile, but the same distance walk in the other direction places you on the Campidoglio or at Trajan's Column. It would be nice if you could cut through the Forum to get to the Colosseum, but it's worth it to us to stay in such a nice hotel that close to the ancient sites. Also, we learned to use the buses more this trip...buy a three day pass and save your energy (pass also works on the metro and the train to Ostia). The bus stop is a block from the hotel. The front desk staff are professional, English speaking, efficient, polite. The lobby is large, lots of glass, marble, brick, and views out to the garden. The hallways and rooms are very spacious, larger than U.S. hotels. We were dismayed at first that the air conditioning wasn't working, so I asked at the front desk, and the young man said "Oh, I will turn it on for your room". He pressed a button there at the front desk, and we had great a/c after that. Efficient, though it would be nice if we didn't have to ask for it to be turned on. Everything is new, clean, designed for comfort of the traveler. We did not hear other guests. Lovely restaurant where a very nice breakfast is included with the room. The prices on the menu for dinners seemed high, and there good restaurants nearby (several along the V. di Portico di Octavia, a three block walk), so we didn't eat dinner there. However, I peeked into the window of the kitchen (along the front of the hotel) and it was immaculate, good to know. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: jbe_worldtravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, with upscale modern accommodations. The rooms while small are very clean and well decorated. the bathroom was great, our room had a jacuzzi shower with plenty of high pressure water. The one drawback was that our room had no air conditioning, unfortunate after a walk in the heat, mid afternoon, but it cooled off nicely in the evenings by cracking the window. The view from the room was great, as the hotel is situated on a small side street on the back side of palatine hill. Another benefit was the generous free buffet breakfast. Plenty of variety, and easily saves 10 euro a person from your daily food bill. While the hotel is situated right near the ancient ruins, it is quite a walk to get around to any of them. It is also a bit of a walk from the nearest Metro station (Circo Massimo). That said, we didn't run into any trouble getting around, just a bit of a walk. Walking up the street also takes you to gorgeous views of the Roman Forum, and a bit further and you are on Capitoline Hill. Overall would recommend, but check to see if the air conditioning is working, before you book!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: holidayluck
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through lastminute.com - one of their 'top secret' hotel deals. Kolbe delivered more than I expected and I would highly recommend this hotel for a short stay in Rome. The price was very reasonable. Our room was very spacious, clean, modern and comfortable. The staff really friendly and helpful, breakfast was a nice added bonus too. Our main concern when looking to book a room in Rome, was the location. After doing much research, it seems you really do pay for a decent location. Kolbe hotel is right in the middle of the historic part of the city. The view from the bedroom literally overlooking the back of the Roman Forum. You are walking distance from the Forum, Colosseum, Capitoline museums and a further stroll to the Pantheon area. If you would rather use the public transport, buses and the metro are within easy reach- about 10 min walk. Overall a great place to explore rome from.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Location”
Reviews.Author: lucylu888
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't stay here again. It was a nice hotel but SO far (walking wise) to get anywhere. My husband and I walked alot in Rome. On the map, the hotel looked so close to the Forum and colesseum. But the real location is behind the Forum. So you still have to walk around the whole Forum to get to the front entrance. There's not alot of restaurants nearby. I would suggest a hotel near the spanish steps if you want to be near restaurants and nightlife. Anything near Old Rome (coloseum and Forum) is too quiet at night. The hotel restaurant was good. Wifi has to be paid for. Hotel service was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Jerrald
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via their website and got given the incorrect price of 30 Euros per night! The hotel contacted me to say they were sorry but could not honour that price. Agreed a price of 90 Euros per night, a room upgrade and a bottle of sparkling wine on arrival. Arrived late at night and checked in. Room size okay but not large - not sure how small non upgrade room would have been. Sheets had holes in them. Shower door broken. Aircon not working - when we asked the first time we were told that we could not control this from our room but that they could and would do so. Asked again the next day and were told that given that it is April the aircon is not on and only heat can be given out. Was a warm April and so had to open windows which meant room was fairly noisy with cars going past cobbled road. Sparkling wine not there on arrival but was brought to us when asked so not a problem. Good points - lovely decor, very good breakfasts, excellent location (room view of roman forum, 10 minute walk to colosseum, 20 minute walk to piazza navona, 45 minutes walk from the vatican). It would not take much for this hotel to obtain ratings of five out of five but unfortunately some small points did let them down.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel with amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: CariCassie
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome with my family and we stayed at the Kolbe Hotel. From the first moment we arrived at the hotel, the staff was very accomodating and friendly. The room was clean and inviting. The location fo the hotel is ideal for the traveler. Within walking distance of the bus line and across the street from the Forum. The one of the best parts of my stay was getting to know the wait staff in the hotel restaurant. Alessia and Claudio were fabulous! We often ate in the dining room because the food was so amazing but also for the smiling faces and kind conversation of the staff. I would greatly recommend this hotel. When I return to Rome, I will be staying at the Kolbe.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great rooms and gardens”
Reviews.Author: fdKen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. It looked onto the roman ruins and was superbly located close to many attractions. It is a little bit away from a metro stop. The breakfast was exceptional for standards in Italy. Only failings was the showers were tiny, and our room faced the street and the noise of cars on the cobblestones was loud at times. Cooling on a/c did not work as it was still winterish outside. Our friends had rooms on the inside garden and they would be preferable. The decor outfittings are modern and with its location we were very pleased with this as our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RyanM240
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, good staff, good location opposite the Roman Forum, quite central to the main attractions within Rome, it is a 5-10 minute walk to most places however it is worth it for the excellent service and facilities of the hotel, if needs must, it is always possible to get a taxi from the hotel to where you are going, really nice rooms, very spacious, modern and clean, foyer of hotel is very nice, all elegantly hidden within the facade of an old building. Nice hotel for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “A modern hotel that is perfectly located.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTrotters
Reviews.Content: If you wish to stay by the ruins of the Roman Empire then this hotel is the place to stay. Although this hotel looks out on to to the Roman Forum if you take a few minutes walk to the left of the hotel then you get a breathtaking view of the main part of the Forum with the Colosseum in the background (see my photo) and if you take a right out of the hotel then you will be at the grounds where the Chariot Racing was held (Circus Maximus), which is overlooked by the Imperial Palace (again, see my photos). I can not recommend this hotel enough, not just for its location but the standard of hotel. The room we stayed in was not massive, but adequately sized, the bed was soo comfortable - if there was not so much to see and do in Rome I probably would have spent longer in there! The staff were all extremely polite and helpful and the hotel in general was spotless and I cannot fault in anyway - OK, we all know that hotels can be overpriced and would be great if cheaper but I also know that the cheaper hotels in Rome are mainly around Termini station (lots of research), this area I do not recommend as, for one, it is too far from the centre of Rome and two, it is not the most pleasant of areas! Therefore worth spending just that little extra to stay at the Kolbe Hotel. This trip was for a nice romantic break away and was not disappointed in any way. NOTE: Although Rome is a beautiful city it also attracts undesirables so please remain alert at ALL times.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, fresh hotel. Convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Pensionspender
Reviews.Content: Visited Rome for my husband's 70th birthday. Was impressed by the reviews I had read but hotel surpassed my expectations. Booked directly with hotel and got seasonal discount (3 nights for 2 plus 1 extra night) Took a shuttle bus from airport to Termini ( 5 or 6 euro each and a letter H bus to Garabaldi bridge 1 euro each. It was then a 10 minute walk to the hotel which was no problem as we were on a 4 night stay and travelling light with 2 pieces of hand luggage. At reception we were welcomed warmly and efficiently ...orientation info and map and welcome drink voucher. Our room(superior) was a good size and nicely fitted with good quality fittings. The beds were comfortable with clean pillows every day. The air conditioning was easy to set and very effective. The Jaccuzzi bath was amazing but a slight hurdle to negotiate getting in and out! (Remember our age) After arrival we discovered a water leak in the bathroom and inside 3 minutes we had 3 members of staff sorting out the problem. Bathroom lighting as good as any hotel I have visited and found lighted magnifying mirror especially useful. Fresh towels every day. Breakfast was generous self service with varied selection to suit all tastes. Tables were constantly cleared by very helpful staff. We enjoy good health and mobility and walked to every sightseeing spot and a LOT more. We ate in Trastevere area across the Tiber and had good Roman food every night. (Asked local business people and ex pats where they would eat) Had one of the best short breaks ever and I can assure you we have had plenty!!!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WestCountryNorthy
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel on the 16th febuary for 4 nights. From the moment we stepped into the kolbe we knew we had made a great choice of hotel. The location is ideal, it is set back in a small residencial area meaning that it is quiet but close enough to the main tourist attractions eg 25 minutes walk to pantheon,trevi fountain and the colosseum and a 5 minute walk from the roman forum.Prices in rome are very expensive due to both the euro and basic tourist mark up. streets are cobbled so high heels are a no no, and crazy drivers on the roads make it dangerous for small children so would not take them.We stayed in room 224 which is the one with the arched window in our picture. It was spacious and comfortable, and cleaned daily. Overall our rome trip was a great experience , would highly recomend the hotel kolbe and hope to go back there one day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Short break”
Reviews.Author: BethanyHall
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our short stay at the Kolbe Hotel. From the moment that we were welcomed to the hotel by Michael in reception we knew we had made the right choice. He gave us an enthusiastic and informative introduction to the area and a map to help us see the most while we were there. The Kolbe is a bright and modern renovation, with tasteful decor and furnishings. Our room was spacious and had all we looked for; the restaurant served excellent food, wine and service,although it is more expensive than nearby restaurants. Breakfast is buffet style and has a reasonable selection of foods; get there early for the delicious freshly baked croissants! We found the location ideal in the historical part of Rome, on a quiet street, although the main restaurant area is a walk over the Tiber we did not find this a disadvantage. The staff here are so friendly and helpful they make a stay at the Kolbe a real pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: ansuk
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here i didn't hesitate in booking the Kolbe Hotel when i was looking for a place to take my partner for our 9th Anniversary. Sadly i was very dissapointed! Firstly when we arrived we were taken to our room which when booked was a standard double. On entering the room it appeared that we had been upgrade to a suite as there was a spiral staircase however, when we went up the stairs we were presented with an empty floor with a TV, no bed, no chairs, no sofa - just am empty space! I telephoned reception and asked where the furnature was and was told there wasn't any and it was as it was meant to be, just an empty space with a TV! After around half an hour in the room it started to get rediculously hot although we switched on the AC. In the end we asked to change rooms and were taken to a relatively small double room. This room had a computer desk and flat screen TV and as i run my own business i have to take my laptop with me wherever we go and as it seems you cannot get any other UK TV Channels in the EU except World News, i always put some movies on my laptop for us to watch before we go to bed. I also always take my SVCD to RGB adapter so we can plug the laptop into the TV and watch the movies on there instead of on the laptop. In this case however, although the TV had both RGB and HDMI outlets they were disabled so we were unable to use it. I checked this again with reception who also confirmed these were disabled. In the 7 years of running my own business and taking my laptop with movies and adapter, i have never come accross a Hotel which has disabled the scart outlets! As we arrived at night we didn't get to see much on the way to the hotel to really determine it's position but as all the reviews on TA say how central the hotel is i didn't think i had anything to worry about but the hotel is far from central. In fact it's about 3 miles outside of the old Rome town centre, ie where any shops and restaurants are. My partner is disabled but we honestly thought a 5 minute walk would take us to the restaurants but old Rome and any restaurants are a 3 mile walk away. Hardly ideal for a disabled person with difficulty walking! On the plus side though you are surrounded by ruins which is the whole point in coming to Rome. Rome has to be the most stunning city in the world but unless you like a 3 mile walk to eat out then find a different hotel. If you also expect a 4* hotel to provide 4* service with 4* ammenities then find a different hotel. We would come back to Rome in a heartbeat but most definately not at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Spacious”
Reviews.Author: BindiB
Reviews.Content: Rome was wet on our first day and getting anywhere on foot ended up with a soaking. It seemed we should have booked a hotel where everything was close at hand! However, as the weather improved, our choice of hotel become more suited to our needs. The room was spacious - we had a triple room. The bathroom was wonderful - getting in and out of such a huge bath/shower might challenge a less agile person. The mosaic tiles and lighting were excellent. We paid the hotel rate and felt this was OK for the size of room and facilities. Breakfast was very good and staff were helpful. Hotel was modern, smart and finished with high quality surfaces. There is no printing available at the computer so you cannot print out your boarding pass for the flight home. You have to email it to the hotel email and they print it for you. In poor weather, walking to the restaurants is a chore. In good weather it would be lovely. Also, not a good choice for families with very young children as the streets and pavements are all cobbled. Pushing a pushchair would be hard work! Rome is currently expensive due to euro/£ rate, but there are some good places to eat which are not too expensive. The metro is a good 10 minutes walk, but buses are close. However, tickets have to be bought from a newsagent in advance. On the buses, no-one checks the tickets as they have to be self-stamped on the bus. These don't appear to work and the Romans just tell you not to worry about it. Transport is therefore extremely cheap as everyone reuses the tickets! We used a minibus from the airport and his return fare was much cheaper than the hotel's transport. Getting there by metro is possible, but it leaves you with quite a walk from Colusseum stop. Very highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: IonLucaCaragiale
Reviews.Content: We loved the location – very closed to the Forum wall and on a rather quiet street. The hotel is situated in an old building, renovated with taste. The staff was friendly and helpful. I hope we will come back this hotel some day . We’ve been in a couple of tours with Presto Tours. The guides were very knowledgeable and engaging. Another benefit was that we avoided the long queues at the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look any further than Kolbe”
Reviews.Author: brightonstu2
Reviews.Content: Stop browsing this is the one. Spent at least 10 hours online so you don't have to. Firstly the Hotel's website has the best rates (I got a double en suite for 102 euros a night with seasonal discount). Great location, at foot of Palatino Hill, 2 minutes from The Tiber and Trastevere (nice restaurants bars etc) and only 10 minutes walk from centre, so we explored Rome centre in the day and hit the Restaurants and bars at night. kolbehotelrome.com gives a better and fair description of facilities. Building is actually more classy than in photos I saw with understated interiors and quality fittings in an architecturally accomplished convertion of an old monastery. When we arrived, the staff offered complimentary drinks and a snack if we wanted while they sorted the online reservation- we had a coffee in the nice citrus lined garden (which wasn't on the bill). Then took our bags to our room: which was great, wide bed and TV, quality, stylish fittings in room and bathroom with bath + Jacuzzi shower. Room looked out onto garden on Ground floor. Not the prettiest bit of the garden but OK. On the second Night we asked to move rooms purely so we could look out on the Palatino hill on the other side and this was no problem at all. The concierge simply asked us the view we wanted and moved our bags - class! The breakfast was delicious with all the usual stuff - bacon eggs cereal nice coffee, fruits etc but also hand made pastries (croissants pain au chocolat and various others made to the highest Patissier standards). Staff were also helpful with directions which is a good indicator for quality of service. I think enough said, many thank to the staff and owners of the Kolbe.

Reviews.Title: “Kolbe is the perfect choice....”
Reviews.Author: Need2Explore
Reviews.Content: This review comes a little late as we stayed at the Kolbe Hotel in August 2008. I went with my mother and sister and found the Kolbe on Hotels.com. I was not disappointed. It was quiet for the time of year but better so we didn't have to deal with any large crowds. The hotel is beautiful as seen in the photos. Rooms are large and very clean. Bathrooms are very European and beautiful as well. Staff are friendly and helpful. We arrived back late one evening and needed water and the front desk happily supplied 2 bottles to us free of charge. Breakfast which was included was very nice and had my favorite available....Nutella! There is a beautiful terrace in the back where everyone sits to enjoy their breakfast or evening cocktails. It is a short 10/15 min walk to all attractions. All in all, it is a wonderful hotel and I would definitely stay there the next time I travel to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: rcools
Reviews.Content: Despite the late arrival the staff at the reception were very friendly and even opened the (already closed) bar for us to have a drink. Due to the extreme bad weather the day before our arrival we were confronted with a leakage in the room and an annoying drip during the first night. We were offered a new, and more quiet room (garden side) for the days afterwards. The location is perfect (next to the Palatino), ideal for walking the city after a good breakfast. The hotel restaurant is also above average.

Reviews.Title: “What A Cool Place!”
Reviews.Author: Muskellonge
Reviews.Content: We ended our 12 day trip to Italy with two nights at the Kolbe in Rome. What attracted us to the property was: (1) proximity to ancient Rome, (2) great scores at TripAdvisor.com, (3) the novelty of staying in a renovated convent. Price was important, but, in the end, we found everything is pricey in Rome! Getting there was no problem. We arrived by rail at Roma Termini, and took the Hop On/Off bus to their stop at Circus Maximus. The hotel was only a 5-minute walk heading towards the Forum--easy! Since we live in an urban condo, we were hoping for a great artistic vibe in this re-do. We were not disappointed. From the semi-circular glass doors, to the cool lighting in the halls, to the brick-barreled ceilings we were very impressed. The menu at the restaurant was, thankfully, not your standard fare in Italy. We ate there our first night after our complimentary welcome drink. All I can say is, after traveling from Venice to Amalfi and then to Rome, we received our best meal here. Finally, a chef willing to display his talents! Magnifico!! Our waitress was also superb as was the bar service. The only complaint? Their internet ran at a snails pace . . . extremely slow. But now I'm picky. Lastly, we booked direct after pricing them against their internet competitors. Kolbe has a commitment to not be undersold, and they weren't. Highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful October Break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Gasman_8
Reviews.Content: Newly modernised traditional building close to the river and the forum which was a little difficult to find in the dark for the first time but, because it was well off the main streets, was quiet and a good haven after a hard day "Roaming"! A lovely garden, reasonable bar and restaurant, extremely clean rooms, very helpful staff. Early mastery of the bus routes is advised but a close bus-stop with manty options gives good access to all parts of the city when the legs tire. Beds are hard, dont expect much English TV or any Sport in any language. Not particularly Italian feel but reasonably priced and cleanly efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, perfect location for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kent_UKChloe
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I paid a flying visit to Rome earlier this month - we were only there for 3 days and wanted to make the most of our time there. After carefully researching potential hotels on Trip Advisor we decided on Kolbe Hotel and were not disappointed. Though located to the rear of the Forum it was incredibly peaceful (very important after roaming the hectic streets of Rome all day), very clean and the staff incredibly helpful. The tour buses all stop close by and these are a brilliant way to get your bearings when you first arrive - we got the big red bus and, for approx 15 euros, you get a ticket that's valid for 24 hours. You can hop off and on at any of the designated stops around the city and the map they give you is incredibly easy to follow. The hotel is also close by to the Trastevere district over the river - do go there in the evening as the alleyways are crammed full of restaurants serving incredibly reasonable food far cheaper than the main tourist areas (mains approx 5 euros and a bottle of wine 10 euros). A tour of the Vatican is a must - it was the high light of our trip and we booked woth 'Through Eternity Tours'...phenomenal!

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel....”
Reviews.Author: turbo_5_reno
Reviews.Content: just got home from 3 wonderful nights in rome. i took my girlfriend for her 21st birthday and we both loved every minute in this superb hotel and in this magical city. i cant fault this hotel. location was excellent, the rooms where very clean, service was faultless. the bar prices where reasonable in comparison to other places we visited. if you go to rome, you must go to the trastevere area to eat, the food is excellent, much better than in the 'tourist area's'. " a tip for any would be visitors to the colleseum... watch out for sparticus and his mates trying to take your picture... very costly!!!"

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: bodgeUk
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with this hotel. Spotlessly clean with really nice decor. It was great to come back to this hotel after a hard day of walking around Rome in the heat! The location was perfect and there was no noise at all, not even from the rooms next door. Slightly softer beds and hot drink making facilities would have been nice but the positive aspects far outweighed these minor niggles. I chose this hotel on the basis of the excellent trip advisor reviews and I will certainly be using this method to select my hotels in future!

Reviews.Title: “Great value at Kolbe Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellingfamily5
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five that stayed for 3 nights at the Kolbe Hotel prior to a cruise. I looked at many hotels in Rome through multiple websites looking for at least a 4 star hotel that would accomodate a family of 5 (two connecting rooms with beds for 3 children ages 15,13 and 11). I had finally decided on the Splendide Hotel but at the last minute found the Kolbe. After speaking directly to the hotel I booked a senior room at the Kolbe for half the price of the Splendide with the guarantee of 2 connecting rooms with one king size bed and 3 separate beds for my children. The hotel staff was very accomodating and easy to communicate with. The hotel is very new, modern and everything is spotless. Our rooms overlooked the Forum and you could hear traffic noise outside which was a little annoying. The air conditioning in our room was not as powerful as the kids room. The connecting rooms opened to a private interior hallway but the doors had to be kept shut in order for the lights and air conditioning to work. So it was not convenient to go room to room but we worked out a system which included getting multiple door keys. I believe the rooms overlooking the courtyard are bigger and quieter. Rooms were nice with lots of storage space. Flat screen TV which we never watched because we were out most of the time, though my kids did watch Italian game shows since the only English TV was CNN and BBC Newsworld. The beds were quite hard but still managed to sleep well. Breakfast was served outside and was ok with scrambled eggs, cold cereals, cheese, cold cuts and pastries. It would have been nice to have more fresh fruit and toast. Staff was very helpful with arranging a driver to pick us up at the airport to the hotel, the same driver then took us to the port for the cruise and he was waiting for us when we got off the ship to take us to the airport. I would recommend this hotel if you only have a few days to stay in Rome and will be out of the hotel a fair bit. If I was planning to stay longer I might look for a hotel where the decor was a bit more traditional since I found it a bit too modern for my taste. Also it would be nice to be closer to the shopping areas. I might try the Splendide next time but then again the Kolbe hotel was quite reasonable in price and we spent the extra money in the most amazing tours. We booked tours with Through Eternity Cultural Association and they made our trip memorable. We booked a private Vatican tour with them and the Ancient Rome Walking Tour as well as Rome by Twilight Tour. The guides are extremely knowledgeable and make the history come alive. By taking all three tours we were able to get a great understanding of the history of Rome. Be prepared for lots of walking in hot weather but we really enjoyed it and my kids never complained once. For the short jet lagged time we spent in Rome we had a great time exploring Rome, eating pizza and drinking wine (not the kids!!) The only negative thing that happened was my husband left his camera in the front seat of the taxi when we went to the Vatican and even though we had the taxi drivers name and ID and phoned the taxi company within minutes of getting out the cab the driver said there was no camera. So we were down to one camera which I then dropped on the cobblestones in front the Tivoli fountain the next night. Needless to say we had to purchase a new camera prior to getting on the cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Adjacent to the Forum”
Reviews.Author: Shanehoustonlittle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is adjacent to the south side of the Forum and within walking distance to many of the ancient attractions. When you walk into the hotel there there is a smart crisp lobby. The rooms overlooking the courtyard seemed a little larger than the rooms overlooking the Forum. The beds were very nice with great mattresses and linens. The breakfast had an enormous selection of continental and english breakfast staples. We utilized the free breakfast almost every day but did not eat lunch or dinner here. The room sizes and the recent renovations seemed like a very good value for Rome in the summer. The only downside to this location was the distance to the nearest Metro station. Though there were not very many restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the hotel, the neighborhood to the south and the one six blocks east across the river made up for this with their sheer number of restaurants. If I ever stayed in Rome again I might want to try a different location but the hotel rooms here make up for any inconvenience in visiting the other areas of town.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: streakySWales
Reviews.Content: Outstanding stayed with my wife and daughter for five nights. We had visited Rome five years previously and stayed on that occasion at the Hotel Mascagni. Should we return to Rome again then there is no doubt that the Kolbe would be top of our wish list. On our arrival we were given a free upgrade and the room was outstanding with a jacussi bath/shower and a most enjoyable massage chair. This was most welcome since those that have visited Rome know you walk miles throughout the day. The room was spotless and the beds were extremely comfortable. Breakfast was in a beautiful terraced garden and whilst not having the choice that some hotels offer, the breakfast was ideal and ticked all the boxes. Staff were extremely welcoming and friendly. Would I recommend this hotel "Yes" would I want people to go there "No" I want to keep it to ME. Go on spoil yourself "Your Worth it"

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cateringlady
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a good location of Rome - Within Walking distance of the Ruins - Rooms are very nice and a good breakfast - We were very pleased - Parking is a bit of an issue if you bring a car as is finding the hotel by car - Very friendly and helpful staff - although no one mentioned the dress code of the vatican which would have been helpful -

Reviews.Title: “Best possible choice”
Reviews.Author: ylvse
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for a five nights. We had one of the junior suites, an excellent choice for a family of four. The room was big, two floors, nice view and a jacuzzi bath. Wonderful. A/C was working perfectly and you need it when in Rome in July. Excellent location for main sights. As staded before you are close to Palatinen but you have to walk 20 min to get to the entrance. If you prefer not to walk around to much the metro station Circus Massimo is 10 minutes away. Taxi from the airport is Euro 40 and if you want to use the hotels private cab service it is Euro 60. Very good breakfast with a selection ranging from fruits to bacon and egg. Wonderful to sit out in the garden having breakfast. Absolutly a place to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel! Ideally located!”
Reviews.Author: CCRN31
Reviews.Content: I have to say that this hotel gave us a room without a reservation. We were originally scheduled to stay at the Best Western Globus but after driving around the area and noticing we were literally in the ghetto of Rome (women scantily clad without wearing panties) we decided against staying there and looked for other options. The gentleman at the desk was quite nice and willing to help us, the hotel itself is ideally located close to tourist areas. The rooms are small and the beds are hard but they do have a nice shower and being that they accomadated 8 people I have to give my hat off to them. I do recommend this hotel to anyone whom wants to be within walking distance to major attractions. Their breakfast buffet was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations exceeded - Cant recommend enough”
Reviews.Author: Irish_Traveller105
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my partner for a four day weekend last weekend. Having read the hotel reviews on this site I had high expectations and am pleased to report that these exectations were met and then some. The Hotel is in a GREAT location, on a quite road near the Colosseum and near the really cool Trastevere area of Rome central. Hotel arranged a car to collect us at the airport, €60 for one way but given the heat last weekend and the distance that Da Vinci airport is from Rome it was well worth it. Hotel staff really friendly, accomodating and eager to help. I booked a superior room and it was really spacious with modern finishes, upholstery and bathroo. Room had a terrace outside which was nice for relaxing on at the end of the day. The A/C was perfect, noted some reports on the hotel suggested internmittent A/C but the trick is to ensure that the windows and doors are all closed for the A/C to work, they all have sensors.......the rooms are very high-tech! The open spaces are really nice, breakfast is great, very generous selection and the bar was nice for some pre-dinner drinks. The Hotel is also nicely positioned in that its quiet at night and away from all the hustle and bustle, yet only a short walk to it all! I'll most certaintly stay their the next time I visit Rome. Enjoy
